targetString: Tuany ë alë bï rɔt wuɔɔk në kuɛɛr kɔ̈k ye kë loi në (CPR) dïktor cï mɛn de tuany de gɔ̈iyɔ̈ɔ̈k ku piɔ̈u, acan thueithuei alë bï bɛ̈n bei të kuuth raan cï thöökic alir acan bï ɣɔr.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Tuany ë alë bï wuɔɔk ëya të jɛk ë raan të wën cï jak në raan cï tuany ku jal yï thok, ku yï wum ku yïn nyïn ëya.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: Aye kɔc kɔ̈k luel wu tuany ë alë bï wuɔɔk në wɛ̈ɛ̈rke  raanic  akë tɔ̈u, acï kɔc ë dɔm arëëtic në yë thölë.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Aye Akuma de pan ye cɔl Chaina jai ku luel wu SARS-CoV-2. ë ace wuɔɔk në wɛ̈ɛ̈r de raanic. Tuanyë ë rɔt wuɔɔk arëëtic në nïn tueŋ ke diäk ëke piɛc yen ke raan dɔm ke tuany ŋot kë rɔt nyuɔɔth në raan guɔ̈p.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Kɔc kɔ̈k acenë kë tuany ya yök në ke gup në them den yic ke tuaany ŋoot ke ken kït yenë ke tuanyë ŋic nyuɔɔth.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: Aye kɔc tök ke ka cï them de gup ke nyuɔɔth ëke tuany ku ka ŋoot kekë kën kït yenë ke tuaanyë ŋic nyuɔɔth.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Aye akutnhom de pan ye cɔl Europe(ECDC) luel wu tuanyë aye aköl tuc arëëtic dac nɔ̈k. Dɛ̈t ëya, raan tok alë bï kɔc ka rou ka diäk ɣok. Kɔ̈m wenë ye tuaanyë bɛ̈i, ë pïïr në aliiric në thɛɛr juëc.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: Kɔ̈m wenë ye tuaanyë bɛ̈i acï yök ke ye tau në lithïk (polypropylene) guɔ̈p ku jal ya 304 ateeka guɔ̈p ke cï dac thou në thɛɛr ke ŋuan. Alë bï tɔu ëya në durucguɔ̈p ku jal ya kɔɔm guɔp.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: Tuanyë ë wuɔi kënë atui ka liɛr de piny. Lääi kɔ̈k acï ke them gup gokë yök ëke tuany në COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Acok ka mɛn ye Biritic ye luel wu ye yök të cïn lääi jak, acïn kë wën ë ye cɔl ë yic mɛn ye tuanyë yök të cïn lääi jak gup.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Tuany yë cɔ̈l coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) yakë pïŋë e tuany jöt. Akɔn yök tenɔŋ kɔc ke diak ëke nɔŋ piɔth wiir pan ye cɔl Wuhan në ̈Chaina.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Tuanyë ye cɔl korona virus SARS-CoV-2 anɔŋ kït ken yeneke ye ŋic. Aye gël të yïn yï cin waak apiɛth në thabun baai acan e ye dac nɔ̈k. Tuany ye cɔl SARS-CoV-2 acï mec kenë SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Aye thɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ kë jɛ̈l cök tënɔŋ agɔɔk.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: Aye yök ke tuanyë  jok rɔt kë ye kɔ̈m ye cɔl betacoronavirus ku Sarbecovirus kenë kɔ̈k cïke yök tenɔŋ dit ye cɔl aliik. peei a gut cï të ben rɔt bɛr wel ke ye kɔ̈m dɛ̈t peei.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: Yen e 96% (thiëërdhoŋuan ku dhetem) në buɔɔtic në thiɔɔk de kenë kɔ̈m tɔu në dit ye cɔl alïïk guɔp. (BatCoV RaTG13).

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: Në Nyith de 2020 ic, dïktor ke China e kë cï̈ jam wu kɔ̈m wenë ye tuaanyë bɛ̈i acï rɔt caal ke kɔ̈m de wenë tuany cäk në lɛi ye cɔl pangolins guɔ̈p.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: Acï kɔ̈k luel wu gudhur 92% de kɔ̈m ye cɔl pangolin korona acï rɔt caal ke kɔ̈m ye cɔl SARS-CoV-2 akë tɔ̈u, aye kɔc kɔ̈k luel wu pangolin acen yenë kɔ̈m tɔu thïn.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: Tuanyë alë bï ŋic në kït yeke tïŋ në raan guɔp acaka mɛn yenë ye ŋot ke them në macïn  ye cɔl (rRT-PCR) ku CT raan guɔ̈p ke raan kënë them.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Aye dïktor ke Chaina luel wu them piɛth ë bï raan thur piɔ̈u në kë  ye cɔl CT. Awar them wën yenë riɛm them në kë ye cɔl PCR.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: Mënë kol në 2020 yic, ke Amerika acï jam wu ke ye cɔl CT acï kɔr bï ya yen ekë ye wɔ tuany ye cɔl COVID-19 them yetök.

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: Akutnhom ye cɔl WHO acë käŋ ke them  cï mɛn de RNA bɛ̈i bïnë SARS-CoV-2 ya them ëke juëc kë kön ë nïn 17.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Ë tuanyë aye them në ka juëc arëëtic cï mɛn de reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: Tuanyë alë bï them në gɔ̈iyɔ̈ɔ̈kic ku riimic ëya.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: Raan ayenë Thueithuei löm ku jal go them në na töŋ tɔɔi.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: Tuanyë ayenë thueithuei löm në raan wum ku ariölic ku leerë ken ɣöl de them. Dïktor kɔ̈k a loi ka ke ye tuaanyë acïn bë them cë ye bɛr guöp

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ye Akɔ̈nydït nïn 6 2020, acïn them wën cï jal gam në raan eben ke yen piɛth.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: Pan US athɛ̈m ye riɛm mit cï jɔk Cellex acï gam bï ya luɔ̈i ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc them gup thïn cï kek gam akuma ke pɛ̈c.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: Dïktor acï kä ke them loi ago ëke juëc. Ke ye cɔl (CT) ayen raan them raan ago cï raan cï raan kënë käŋ yenëke tuany ŋic.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: Akuma de pan ye cɔl Itali akɔɔr bï adet cï tuany nɔ̈k ya kuen ku gɛ̈t piny.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: Kɔ̈m yë cɔ̈l ̈adeno kënë ë duɔr thöŋ kenë tuɛnytuɛny kɔ̈k wenë gɔ̈iyɔ̈ɔ̈k dɔm ku kä ye them në PCR mɛn në COVID-19 nyuɔth.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: Dïktor juëc ke pan ye cɔl Chaina yakë lueel wu kë de them de piɔ̈u CT awar kë de them de Thueithuei PCR.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: Akutnhom dɛt acï loi bï tuany ë ya them në riɛmic ku thueithuei cï mɛn de CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: Thɔ̈ɔ̈l ke gël de röth akë: akɔɔr bï raan ya cam në miɛth nɔŋic thaka, akɔɔr bï raan ye cin ya waak në nyindhiɛ, akɔɔr bï raan ye thok, ku yewum ku ye nyin cë ye jak ke raac cïn. Akɔɔr bï raan ya tiim ku xɔl ke cï ye wum kum.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: Kɔc cï tuany aye ke yɔ̈k bï ke wuum ya kum të rëër në kɔc cic.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Apiɛth bï kɔc ya rëër ëke nɔŋ kaam mecic ago kɔc rɔt cë ɣok. Akumat juëc acï caath cï yic riil nyaai ku bï kɔc cë lɔ pan dït ë tuany thïn.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: Ke yen, eë kɔ̈më acï rɔt bɛ̈n thiai në bɛɛi yic në biakdït de pinynho.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: Ku wɛ̈tde ic kɔc kɔ̈k acï tuany në akuut bai yic, ku kɔc kɔc akut bai ic aa kuc ye tëno ku ye këde yen luɛŋ kek. Akïm tït nyïn raan cï luaŋ aacï kek thiëc ku bïk rɔ̈t tit apath, kɔc röm ke kek, ku tiɛ̈t nyin. Yäp ye kɔc cï röm kek kɔc ci luaŋ yɔ̈p e muɣɛm tën kɔc lui alɔŋ pial guöp ku bïk të ye tuany bɛ̈n thïn ŋic ku gɛ̈l kä tek ot piny akölciɛ̈n.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Manadhamat acï ke cin mat bïkë thɔ̈ɔ̈r kenë tuanyë ago pinynhom cë nak ku manadhamat ke 100 aci ke cin bɛn mät ku bi ke tuany ca dhuk piny bi ce ben dit areetic.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Kä juëc e lui në telepunic aake cï ke loi wälë nhothke bï ke ya loi abac, mënë ye Akɔ̈nydït nïn  7, 2020, kee akutnhom cë piöc thiär kurou ku nhom aake lui në dhölë luɔm piɛthka määth, cït yïk blututh ago të de raan nɔŋe ya täu thïn kekë telepuun kök.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: Telepun kënë ë koth kënë thiɔ̈k wenë raan tuany në COVID-19. Wël ce yith acath në biak de gël ë ye tuanyë; cï mɛn yenë ye luel wu lɔ̈ɔ̈k de wum ku lɔ̈ɔ̈k de thok acï lui.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: Acïn wal de COVID-19 cï loi emɛnë. Dïktor aŋöt ëke kën wal loi.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï kɔc ke cin ya waak në nyindhiɛ ago tuany rɔt ce ɣook.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: Aci kɔc ke CDC luel wu kä kɔɔr bï kɔc ke cin ya waak në nyindhiɛ të cïn raan lɔ në bakana yïc ka të kɔɔr bï cam. Akɔɔr bï raan ya cin waak ëya të cïn yï wum thony.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Kum wenë në ye tuaanyë bɛ̈i aye thubun nɔ̈k të cin raan ye cin waak apiɛth.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: Akutnhom de CDC de gël de tuany ë jam wu apiɛth bï raan ye cin ya waak ëya në asabun 60% cï cirka loi ke yen kɔc ke cin tɔ̈i.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: Akutnhom ye cɔl WHO mɛn ye loi në biäk de tuany ë kɔc yɔ̈k ye bï raan ye nyin cï jak të kën yïn piiny apiɛth.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: Ɣan nɔŋ acuɔl  alë bïke weec në käk juëc cïke liap (në digika tök e loi ɣen rɔt në ɣan ke stainless steel) cï mɛn de 62-71% ethanol, 50-100% Isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, ku 0.2-7.5% povidone-iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Anaŋ thabun kök cï ye kɔ̈me dac nɔ̈k cïmen benzalkonium gluconate, ace qisc lui apath.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: Akutnhom de CDC de gël de ye tuanyë ë ja m wu na cï raan yɔ̈k ke tuany e COVID, ke ka cïke jak ebën akɔɔr bïkë weec në asabun ago kɔc cë wɔɔk ëya. Ka cïke jak cï mɛn de telepun, koth, ku jal ya kä juëc kɔ̈k ci mɛn de ATM ke baai.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: Aye akutnhom de gël de tuany luel wu bï raan ye thok ku ye wum ya kum në ye kɔr te xɔl yïn ka te tïïm yïn. Na yïn cï yï wum kum na alath ke cuat ë wei ku duɔnë ber tau në yï wum.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Alɛ̈th ye kɔc ret ke thook ku wum kum aacï kek puɔ̈l tën kɔc cï luaŋ, rin cɛ̈ŋcɛ̈ŋ alanh ye kɔc ke wum ku hook kum alɛ̈u bï köm rot cï wer piny ku cäth ye tuany cath kɔc thook të jɛm raan, thïm raan ku të ɣɔl raan.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: Akutnhom de WHO  acï lɛk kuɛɛr wën yenë kɔc ke wuum kum.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: Aye dïktor ye cɔl Stephen Griffin, raan lui alɔŋ käm jama Leeds luel,  cɛ̈ŋcɛ̈ŋ alanh ye kɔc ke wum ku thook kum alɛ̈u bï göt ye kɔc ke nyïïn lac gɔt dhuök piny, ku e yen te ye kɔc lac luaŋ thïn ke cïn aguiɛr cin cï looi. "Alɛ̈th ye kɔc ke wum ku thook kum aacï kek gam bï kɔc tït nyïïn raan la guöp la guöp tuany kek cɛŋ kek.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: Akutnhom de u mɛn gël  tuany ë jam wu raan cïn guɔ̈p tuany apiɛth bï ye wum kum të töök xen raan nɔŋ COVID-19, ku kum yënë  kɔc ke wum kuum abi kɔc ya gel te jɛkke kɔc ke nyïïn.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Dollat juëc arët acï kɔc kën piɔ̈i kum de wum ago tuany rɔt ce xook arëëtic.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: Pan ye cɔl U.S, ke ka cï CDC luel wu bï alath de wum ce kë de panakïm ya ceŋ. Acï China luel wu bï alath de wum ye ceŋ ku cuɛtë wei ya ceŋ ne kɔc ke panakïm të biyin në kam cekic (1 metre (3 ft) wenë ke kor) kenë kɔc kɔ̈k.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: Pan ye cɔl Hong Kong acï kɔc kɔ̈k bïkë ke wum ya kum të cɛɛke në arabiya.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: Dïktor ke pan ye cɔl Thailand acï kɔc kën yɔ̈k bïkë alath loi ku yekë ke wuum kum.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: Akuma de pan ye cɔl Czech Republic ku Slovakia acï kɔc kɔ̈k yɔ̈k bïkë ke wum ya kum të le raan caath biɛ.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 16 Akoldit, go akuma de Vietnam raan ëbɛ̈n  yɔ̈k wu bïkë ke wum ya kum të le raan caath biɛ agokï röt ya gël ku kɔc kök pe.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: Akuma de pan ye cɔl Austria acï kɔc kën yɔ̈k bïkë ke wum ya kum të le kek thuuk bïkë lɔ hɔ̈c

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: Akuma de yïthïrel acï kɔc kën yɔ̈k bïkë ke wum ya kum të le raan geeu.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: Akuma de pan ye cɔl Taiwan, acï käŋ ke kum de wum loi keke lëu biana thiëër në min aköldit ku cɔɔle bi ke ceŋ në pɛi nïn 1 Akɔ̈nydït.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: Akuma de pan ye cɔl Panama acï kɔc kën yɔ̈k bïkë ke wum ya kum të le raan geeu. Acï kɔc yɔ̈k eya bïkë alɛɛth ke kum de wum ya loi baai.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Alɛɛth ke kum de wum acï loi eya pan ye cɔl Japan, South Korea ku Malaysia

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: Mec rot wei (bï kɔc rɔ̈t cï ye thiääk) ala ic dhel ye tuany muöknhom thïn cï täu ku bï tuany rot cï tek piny ku thiäk ye kɔc thiäk cɔl akor ic kam kɔc.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Tuanyë aye gël në kuɛɛr juëc, cï mɛn bï raan rëër baai ku cï mɛn bï thukul ku caath thiök thok.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Raan alë bï ya rëër baai ku cï bɛr caath, ku tit rot wei akut ic, ku cï rot ye muöth ke gɔt rot kek raan dɛ̈t, ku mec rot wei.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Akumat juëc acï kɔc kën yɔ̈k bïkë ya rëër ëke nɔŋ kaam mecic ago kɔc rɔt cë xok.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: Akuma de pan ye cɔl Amerika acï kɔc kë yɔ̈k bïkë ya rëër ëke nɔŋ kaam ku akutnom de pialde gup aci luel ye bi kɔc kë 250 (të cïn yen COVID-19 ye wɔɔk)  te nɔŋ kɔc ke 50 leer agut rään 10.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Në 22 Aköldït 2020, akuma de pan ye cɔl Germany acï kɔc kën yɔ̈k bïkë rëër të tok pɔɔl. Tuaanyë arac ke raan cï dhiɔ̈p ku raan nɔŋ tuaany de sukar, tuany de piɔ̈u, tuany de guyɔ̈ɔ̈k, piɔ̈r de rim ku liöp de ka wën ë guɔp gël ku CDC acï jam wu bïkë ya rëër baai. Në thök de Akoldït 2020, WHO ku jal ya akutnhim juëc kɔ̈k acï wɛ̈t ye cɔl mec de yic war ke ye bïkë guup ya ca mec yic.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: Luɛl në wɛ̈t e cɔl "rɛ̈ɛ̈r ye kɔc rɛ̈ɛ̈r kɔc mec iic" acï kuöc det ic lɔn adë ka kɔc acï ben thiäk, kë ke  cï be ke puöth adɛɛt ku bïk rɛ̈ɛ̈r keye tök kamken dhɔ̈ɔ̈l kɔ̈k. Akuma kɔ̈k aacï të ye tik rɛ̈ɛ̈r thïn kek moc guir alɔŋ töc dhaman e tuany kën.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï mony ka tik yök ke raan ë rëër ke ë tok. Na cï mony ka tik ben piny peei ke ka piɛth bï kän them guɔ̈p në kaam ŋöt yen kë kën yök ke kɔc ke baai

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: Akɔɔr Bï raan cï tuany në COVID-19 rɔt ya täw tede ye tök ku raan ye röt diu tuany, ku yakke  mɛi ne keek ke kɔcke, agoke week ci ɣok.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: Kɔc ka kutnhom de pialde guɔ̈p acï kajuec luel në tän benë kɔc cï tuany röth ya luɔi në bɛɛiken yic ku ɣol ceŋkekeek. Akumaat juëc acï ke juiir bï tuaany gël në bɛn ye kɔc juëciic  tuany bë thïn ku në bɛ̈ɛ̈i tuɛɛny keek yic .

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: Ku të bene  raan tuany rot tiit thin: alek kɔc ye kë nhïïm mat te tök ee kë juëc bï     amat nom  pɔl.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Kɔc ye  ben në kɔc guöp ku kɔ̈c ye ben në bɛɛi  kɔ̈k yiic  ee kë tuany në COVID-19 akɔɔr  abï ke ya tɔ̈u në nïn ke 14 te tök gɔl ne köölë bïï  ke agut kööl bene niin ya thieer ku ŋuan.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: Ku tuany aci bɛn them be gel ke ken kɔc kedhia guɔ ɣok.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: Gɛ̈lgɛ̈l tuany e jɔk të puɔc tuany jɔk ku bï kɔc cï luaŋ lac yɔ̈ɔ̈p cök ku lel ke thook ku lɔc dhɔ̈ɔ̈l bï ke tuany gɛ̈l ku të bï wäl yɔ̈k thïn tak iic ku bï tuany cɔl akääc bï kɔc kök cï dɔm.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Na rinic bï gël ke yakke them arëëtic bakke ke ci lueel në ditoor ku akutnhiimke pialde guɔ̈p ya looi cï luɛɛlden.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï Ka ci keek matic  kerou kee yi gelde tuany ku dhɛŋ weei de tuanyi bï ke luɔi ke dhia ago tuany kɔc ci yi tɔɔk.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: Akɔɔr bi kä juëc loi bene ke tuany de pinynhom tiɛt wei ago ce lɔ në 1. Biäk de gel de tuany awic bi rɔt dhit ke ci ben ɣe lëu.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Yen acë wɛl den tɔ̈u themku bukku nyin tiët kɔc kuɔ acï yïlac ku wɛl benë ye tiɛt  wëëi në kɔc guöp.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Aci kɔc ke  pande china bɛn them areetic bi ke  kek cin ya waak ku yenke apac ke cäm waak aya ku tɛu ke  raan tëde ye tok;ku  bi kɔc ci thiä äk në kɔc tuany, ku yekë yic mɛɛi ci men ci në yen luel në bäny de bai, ku ala ic lɔ̈k cin, cɛ̈ŋcɛ̈ŋ  alɛ̈th ye kɔc ke wum ku thook kum, lɛ̈llɛ̈l bï raan ye thok lɛl rot; käk bï ke looi bï baai tiit cïmen mec rot wei, thiök thukuul thook ku pɛ̈ɛ̈n akuötnhom; det puöu akut ku bï rot mat gɛ̈lgɛ̈l tuany ic; ku käk ye ke piny tiit cïmen wɛ̈c piny. Käk juëc e gɛ̈lgɛl tuany yen ye kek ke nhïïm täu thïn cï ɣäth China të cï tuany ye nyin jɔt ku ala iic thiök thok bɛ̈ɛ̈i ku pɛ̈ɛ̈n kɔc bï kɔc cï ben cath.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Bɛɛi pai kɔk ci mɛn de uganda aci bɛn dai në te bene tuany gɛl thin ku nɔŋ ke nyïc në dɔm yene tuany kɔc dɔɔm.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: Pan ye cɔɔl South Korea yenëka ci kɔc ben nyuɔth kaciip bene tuany ya tiŋ:ku ye rään ci tuany cɔ̈k tɔɔu rɔt pande tëde ye tök.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke Pande Singapore aci kɔc bɛn kuɔny në weu ku kɔk juɛc kɔk yeneke kɔc kuny; ku bi kë kɔk ke në kɔc ke (who)  mɛn ne yen akutnom de pialde guɔ̈p ke bɛi.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke ciirka cɔl Taiwan aci alath cɔl  mask yene kɔc ke nyin kum bɛn thiitic;  ku yeke dhiac ke thiok ɣɔ̈n yene kek wal luoi thin. Ku ye kɔc ke Britain ku kɔc ke United Statesya lɔ ɣe ke luel luɛth.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Jämde raan ye cɔɔl Otimal aleu bi kɔc kony ne gel bene tuany gël ci mɛn ye ëë luel në kɔc kë 2/3 ëye lɔ keke  thou ku  dhiɛc kë ɣe ke ɣeet në bɔɔt.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: Tiɛtde ye tuany kënë alɛ̈u bi piath ku awïc bï jäl muk nhom apath ke kɔ̈m ŋuɔt aye rot göt kɔc lɔ̈m (wula ɣɛt dhaman bï wäl yɔ̈k, wula të cï kën kaŋ bën tueŋ), ku tuany ke tek rot piny të go dhɔ̈ɔ̈l yeke tuany gɛ̈l cɔl apuɔl iic.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Aci dhamaldit  areet lär ke ci dɔc jal, yeneka ye we ye tiŋ ke pïïr ci liɔp në piny thook ebën.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Yen tuanykenë aci  wɛldɛtou, ku yen kɔc . ä tou në kɔ̈ɔ̈r de wel de yic: ye tuany cɔɔl  COVID-19.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: Ku tït de nyïn de tuany abi looi areetic ago kɔc ya lɔŋ.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: në covid thiëër ku dhoŋuan,  ëë kɔc yien ɣɔl ku thionythiony ku cɔ   wëëi dɔm rɔt bi raan ci wɛi apieth duye ya kë  thok.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: Ku dek de wɛl wen ci röth yök aleu bi tuany cɔ jal wicith; ku jal kɔc tiam areetic.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Kɔc ye tuany cɔl COVID-19 gäm wɛl ci rot yɔk abi kek ya thic thök neke yekke  ye luel ye bi tuany tɔk ke ci ke leu në nyɛɛi.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: Yen aci WHO  luel  wu "kɔc ke kä thɛɛr ku kɔc ke bɛɛi yic" akɔɔr bukku ya lɔ ɣotde wal ku bukkuraan ci tuany në SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: Ku dhiɛɛr ye ne akut nom de pialde guɔ̈p täkden thitic ku kɔ̈r ye kek kɔc tuany në COVID-19 kɔɔr, aci kɔc ke APMP mɛn yene akut nom de pialde guɔ̈p bɛn cɔl ye ya tek thook.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: Aci kɔc kë ECDC  ku kɔc kë pande Europe yë bany ke APMP mɛn yen akut nom de pialde guɔ̈p në piny nom ebën;  aci kä  juɛɛc bê në kë roth tiit bɛn luel ci mɛnde them de tuany COVID-19 bi rään ebën ya them gup në tuany, agorë dhël ë puc ë yic teem kɔ̈u na lëu röt, tëk ku wëŋë thok ayanïn tuany në COVID-19 ku juak käke tïtë nyin yic bï kɔc piööc ku juak adɛn ë käk alir bɛ̈i ku agɛn tɔ̈.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: Ku ka lɔŋ ka juɛc ëke ye keek luel në (raan tueŋ  ëë kɔl tuany dɔm guɔ̈p) ku tënë kɔn ɣe tuany gɔl thin.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Ku raan tueŋ ɣe kɔn tuany  yök në pɛɛi nïn 1 köl 2019 pande china te cɔl ̈̈̈Wuhan ku Hubei ëya.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Ku na ɣɔn në ye pɛɛi de rou  ee yic; go kɔc tuany në coronavirus lɔ keke dhiit röt të cɔl Hubei në china.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Käkä aacï kek thääny kek kën Huanan Seaford thuuŋ ye käŋ guɔl wei thïn, läi pïïr aaye ɣaac wei thïn, ku anaŋ kën ye luel lɔn köm ajäl kam läï; wula, abɔ̈ bei läi gup. Akut pneumonia ecï yɔ̈k aköl nïïn 26 pɛi thiärkurɔu ku acï akïm cɔl Zhang Jixian pan akïm gen Hubei luöi elac, ku acï të ye tuɛnytuɛny gɛ̈l thïl Wuhan Jianghan CDC lɛ̈k aköl nïïn 27 pɛi thiärkurɔu.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Në pɛɛi nïn 30 Köl,  go akutnhon de ditoor nyuc piny ku jiɛɛmke kɔc ku lëkke keek  "SARS mɛn ye cɔl korona".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Ku në kë kɔc kek ke bɛt yic raan tueŋ  ye cɔɔl Li wën Liang aci bɛn dɔm në bolith në ka cen kɔc lëk luëth  ku raan dɛte ye cɔɔl Äi Fen, aci bɛn dɔm në kɔc lui kenë yen në wɛt cen gereeth yup pic.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: Go akuthnom de pial de gup tou pande Wuhan, kɔc lɛk në pɛɛi nïn 31 köl ku lëk kɔc ke APMP ëya.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Ku kɔc juëc ke pan cɔl Wuhan tuaany acï ke be Caal në Wuhan; ku bi keek lɔ thic thok aŋootpenda Akɔ̈nydit,  ku kɔc juëc tuaany aci keek bɛn ya dhiac keke yök kek në  niin thök ke dhorou në bakde kööl.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Në  aköl de Akɔ̈mudïriɛkun, 2020;  go kɔc juëc ke pande China jal tuany në kë yene kɔc lɔ keke caath në  Wuhan pan rou ë tuany thin.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Na  ɣɔn e Kön nïn 20, go kɔc ke china kë cï kɔc ke  140 keke yë jidiir, caal në kool tokic abac ku kɔc ke rou në Beijing ku tök në Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Thönthii cï deet ë jɔl la nyuɔth lɔn cï kɔc ka 6,174 cït nyuɔth wɛ̈nthɛɛr kë Kön e nïn 20, 2020.  Mënë ye Kol nïn 26, kë Amërika wan China ku Italy thook kekë nïmïra de adɛndït cï deet kë cë tuany pinynhom ëbɛ̈n. Mënë ye Akɔ̈nydït nïn 9, 2020, kä tuany wär miliöön 1.61 tuany aake cï caal pinynhom ëbɛ̈n; kɔc ke 97,000 ku kɔ̈k aake cë thou ku 364,000 ku kɔ̈k aake cë pial.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Ku në bɛɛi ke 200 yic; go  bɛɛi ebën guɔ naŋ ran tok dɛ tuany.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Ku në wɛtde tuany de pinynhom, pande Europëë  bɛɛi juec ke pande Schegen aa kene keek bɛɛn bën ca cath.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Thɔ̈ɔ̈l ke gël në bɛɛi yic anɔŋic bï raan ye rëër tetök( ye cɔl rëër baai, rëër tetök wenë thök de käŋ) ku tɛ̈u de thɛɛr ke loi. Ɣan në pɛi nïn 2 Bildït, adɛt de 300 million, wenë 90% atɔu ke rëër në bɛɛi yic në United States, adet war 50 million acike thök nhiim thïn në Philippines, adet de 59 million acike thök nhiim thïn në South Africa, ku 1.3 billion në India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Na ɣɔn aye pɛɛi nïn 26 Aköldit, go kë cen raan bene  ca cath; kë ci raan 1.7 billion në piny thook ebën ku kä ci rɔt bɛn dhiit leer abi ya 2.6 billion në nïn ke rou  yiic.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Ku raan tueŋ tuaany në COVID-19 ee jäl yɔ̈ɔ̈k ke pɛɛi ye nïn 1 pende Ɣɔ̈r 2019 në Wuhan; tok ci tuany ë yɔɔk në pɛi nïn 17 Lal.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Go ditoor de pande China cɔɔl Zhang ee ye tiŋ kë Ɣɔ̈r e nïn 26 ku ye në raan leke në Wuhan mɛn ye në Jianghan CDC kë Ɣɔ̈r e nïn 27.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke gɔɔl bi kɔc ya them ke pɛi ye nïn 27 Ɣɔ̈r 2019 , ku ka ye ke ye kä yen cɔl SARS nyuoth ke ci  kɔ̈m cɔl korona.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Go kɔc ke Wuhan piny de China, kɔc piɔ̈ɔ̈c tɛ̈ bï ne tuany tiɛt thin. Kë Ɣɔ̈r e nïn 31.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: Ku kɔc ka kutnhom de pialde gup ye cɔl WHO në pinynhom ebën aci keek guɔ bɛn lëk në ye kool tokŋicyic.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Ku na wën aci keka kek luel: Go bolith Ditoor ye luëth lueel dɔm.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Go kɔc ka kutdhom de pialde guɔ̈p nyuc piiny ku luelkë  ye kä ci kenë yen nyuɔth na ye tuaany rɔt wɔɔk yidɛ? Në tenɔŋ raan në ku raan në?

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pende tok, go kɔc kë chinese kɔc dɔn kɔc than keek;  go bany de china cɔl Xi Jinpin luel ye kene aci ya tɔŋ thɛɛre në ̈̈Virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke pɛɛi ye nïn 23 Akɔ̈nydït,  ke cäth aci bɛn  thiöök thok, go cïn raan ben lɔ bïï në Wuhan  ku raan bɔ thin. Ku ka cï bɛ̈n loi eya në bɛɛi ke 15 ic në Hubei go raac tenɔŋ raan 57 million.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: Riɛ̈th ke wukuma ku riɛɛth ke manadham acï ke be cok kac ku thiɔ̈ɔ̈k cäär.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: Ruɔn jöt de Chinese (25 Akɔ̈nydït) acï bɛ̈n riɔk.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: Kɔc akuma aa cïk cal lɔn bï ke panakïm bïnë kamthin kor nɔ̈k buth, panakïmde Houshenshan, ë thɛ̈pë në buth nïn 10 ic.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Ku dhiɛ̈c kɔc kɔk keke looi panakim kɔk bɛn në kɔc kɔk tuany taw thin.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Eya në biak de panakïm cï yïïk, China acï ɣan ke 14 wen në Wuhan, cï mɛn de ɣan ke kura acike wen eke ye panakïm. Në pɛi nïn 26 Akɔ̈nydït, akuma acï kak juëc kɔ̈k loi acan bï tuany ye cɔl COVID-19 gël, cï mɛn thök de caath ku jal ya kak wën ë juur määt nhom të tök.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Ku thukuul kedhia aci keek bɛn thiok thook në  china.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: Ku pan ye cɔl Hong Kong ku Macau aci thukuul bɛn thiok thook.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Ku kɔc kë china acï bɛn ä looi në Remote.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Cäth aci bɛn thök tenɔŋ kɔc bɔ ku kɔc lɔ bïï.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: Ku cäth de kɔc juëc aci bɛn thiok, ku museums në china aci bɛn thiok thok.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: Gɛɛl de kɔc cath acï bë tääu ke ye löŋ bï cï raan cath go dɛt de 760 million rɛ̈ɛ̈r në bɛ̈ɛ̈i yic. Na ɣɔn cï tuany caal ne pɛi de Akoldït, akuma de china acï dhɔ̈ɔ̈l benë tuany yök

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Cï mɛn de, pan ye cɔl Beijing cï nïn ke 14 tau benë raan ke ya rëër yetok të bï yen pan dɛ̈t. Në pɛi nïn 23 Akoldït, China acenë tuany tök rɔt thiai piny në nïn ke dhic, e raan ë jël në Guangzhou lee Istanbul.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: Në aköl nïn 24 aköldit 2020, go bany tök de bäny ke pande China caal ke tuany cï dït arëëtic panden.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke löŋ acï ke bɛ̈n nyaai  në Hubei, ke ce Wuhan, në pɛ̈ɛ̈i ke rou yic ɣɔn tɛ̈u ëke löŋ. Akuma de China acï jam në pɛi nïn 26 Akoldït 2020 wu ka cïn raan lɔ thïn gɔl në pɛi nïn 28 Akoldït le tueŋ, ku ka kuc ë kol benë ye loŋë kɔ̈ɔ̈c.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Ku na kɔɔr raan be lɔ bïï  ke ye kɔn jam ke bany de bai, ago gäär wereŋ.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke kɔc yeke cɔl Chinese ku akumaden, aci kɔc ke tajiir bɛn yɔɔk bi ke liep kë Kol e nïn 30, ku ke bï wëu bɛ̈i. Akuma acï jam wu mocmoc ke diak kan ya nɔk acan bï kɔc mim në 10:00 kë Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 4, në rëër de Qingming, acak ka mɛn cenë akuma ye luel wu bï loi në cabaka nyin acan bïkë COVID-19 rɔt cë ɣook.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: Ku tuanyye cɔl COVID-19; aci bɛn dɔɔm  pan cɔl South Korea kë Kön e nïn 20 2020 ku jël pande China le pan cɔl South Korea.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: Go kɔc ka kutnhom de pialde gup jam wu tuany acï dit kë Nyith e nïn 20, jam wu amat nom de luel de yecu abi pɔl.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Ku raan cɔɔl Shinch eonji; aci kɔc keek china bɛn lɔ neem pan cɔl Wuhan u yene tënë tɔu kɔc nyin keek tuany thin.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Mënë ye Nyith nïn 22, në kɔc ke kanitha ka 9,336 yic, kë ka 1,261 wälë kë 13% në buɔtic aake cï caal ëke tɔ̈ ke cït. Thauth Koria e cë adɛn dït apɛɛi lëk kɔc caal kë Nyith e nïn 23, 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Në pɛɛi nïn 28 ̈̈̈̈Akɔ̈nythii, kɔc ke  2,000a ä ci keek bɛn   yɔk pande South Korea keke tuany ku dhiit kë rɔt në kɔc ke 3,150 në pɛɛi nïn 29 Akɔ̈nythii.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Go aburuuk kedhia ke pande South Korea them guɔ̈p ɣɔn, ci në kɔc  kediak yök keke tuany në aburuukic..

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: Ku kɔc juɛɛc ye lui në mätar yic, aci keek bɛn yök keke tuany,go kek nyaai tëde luoi:  ku South Korea aci kɔc ci tuany bɛn ya tou tëden ke pɛ̈i.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Them anɔŋic bï raan nɔŋ kït rɔt thaal yetok në kɔc eke bɔ pan pei në telepunic, raan aye them ku jal käŋ bɛ̈n biɛ në köl dɛ̈t, ku them abï dhitic bï ya raan 20,000 yen ye them në köl tök.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Ajuɛɛr de Thauth Koria en aacï täu në kɔc nhïïm kë ye yen cë tiɛm në baŋde titë tuany nyin piny acɔka lɔn kën yen pen ëbɛ̈n täu në wɛ̈ŋic.  Kuande Thauth Koria e yenë cï kaŋ kuöt në bëny Moon Jae-in cök në wɛ̈t cë dhuk në baŋde ariɛr.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Kɔc  juɛɛi ke pan cɔl koriya, aci wereŋ bɛn thiɔŋ  waraŋɛ thic kek akutnom de pialde guɔ̈p në luɔi bene lɔ bii de tuany be në ye gel, ku yekke leec në luɔi piethden.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 23   Aköldit, go kɔc ke south korea guɔ la kɔc liik  në wiik ke diäk yic.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Ku në pɛɛi nïn 29 Aköldit : aci  kɔc ye ke bɔ në piny pei yic be  ya cak tɔu në wiik ke rou ake ci lɔ bii ne pɛɛi në 1 aköldit.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Në biak de kɔc ye kaŋ caal, kekä  yen në kacip looi aci keek bɛn thic  ke pɛɛi yen niin 1 Bildit  , go kɔc ke south korea ka yeneke tuany them loom në bɛɛi kɔk yic, bɛäi ke 121.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Ku na ɣɔn ke kɔc ke pande Iran , thiaan tuany ke ci dɔm pande  ku jam akutnhom de pialde gup ke ci kɔc kerou nɔk ye tuäny cɔl SARS-CoV-2 ku aye aköl de 19 Akɔ̈nythii.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Aŋoot tuany ke ken kɔc juëc nɔk, go bäny de bai thieek ku ka wen ye kɔc mat nhiim thiok thook yïï  thukul,yin lɔɔŋ de paradei ku thiok keriɛc ebën thök.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: Go kɔc ke Iran trillion ke dhiec lɔɔm bi në kë  tuany cɔl korona virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Go bany de baai mɛn cɔl Hassan Rouhani, jam ɣɔn ke pɛɛi yen nin 26 Akɔ̈nythii 2020, jiɛm ye kɔc abike ca lɔ në ɣötic ku ŋɛk tëde ye tök.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Ajuiɛɛr de caath dhuk nyin piny aa cɔɔlë në Akoldït, ke cɔk nɔŋ thiaŋ de cäär në thaar de Persian New Year Nowruz.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke te cɔl shia shrine, aci bɛn dhiac ke ɣɔr agut ɣen pɛɛi niin 16 Aköldit 2020, ku jal Iran rɔth lpou ke yen në metar de thiëi pinyde kɔ̈m, aa ŋoot china ke ken tuany areet në pɛɛi de Akɔ̈nythii.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Mënë ye yenë ye luel en ɣäla cï dhöl becë tuany dɔ̈t Iran, bɛ̈i ka thiär ku kɔ̈k aacë käkɛn kɔr cök në dhukë cïën lɔ Iran arɛ̈k e Nyith nïn 28, ë nyoth lɔnadëk të cï dhoŋbec de dɔ̈t alëu bï rɛɛc apɛi arɛ̈kë bë käka 388 ɣɔn cï caalkä në akuma de Iran wör në nïn ke pɛi kä.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: Kɔc yeke cɔl Iranian aci teden amat de lɔ tueŋ de baai bɛn thiok thook, në cenë kɔc ke 23 në kɔc ic kë 290 bɛn tuany kë Kol ye nïn 3.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Ne  pɛɛi nïn 12 Aköldi, go bany nyuc piny ku bi ke kɔc löny në ɣöt ke dɔɔm yic bi ke ca lɔ në bɛɛi ken yic.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: Ku ke ci luel nan bë në tuany rɔt dhiit pande Iran, can kɔc ake jai bi ke akutnom pɔl.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: Në  pɛɛi nïn 15 Aköldit , go akuma de Iranian kë ci  raan  100 thou në kool tök abac në min në gɔl në tuany.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke 12  ke pande Iran aci bɛn thou, ku käkë yen kɔc ke wukuma në pɛɛi nïn 17 aköldit.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 23 Aköldit, go kɔc ke 50 ya tuany në thaa tökki ku thou kɔc, ye ran tök thou në bocbocii ke thieer në wɛtde covid thieer ku dhoŋuan.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: Tënë bäny ke APMP, alëu bë naŋ kɔc tuany wär kä tuany e caal Iran në arak dhïc.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Ku ka ci dhiac ke luel në kɔc ke Iran luelke ye kɔc ke U.S. tɔu pande ̈̈̈Iran abi wuɔk në ke cen në tuany thiiy bïi.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: Go kɔc ke bɛi ke pinynom ci mat mënë yë në UN, go kek cin juaar be ke kɔc kuɔny ci mënë pande Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: Ku tuany ä  lɔ pan de italy në pɛɛi nïn 31 Akɔ̈nydit, ku kɔc ee ke leer reen aye chinese ke rou ëke lɔ pande Rome ëke tuany në SARS-CoV-2 pande Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Tuany aci ben gɔl ku dhiit eyic areetic, go akuma de italy thɔɔr ke në yen areetic.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Akuut kën mat de COVID-19, agɔl në kɔc ke 16 pan cɔl Lombardy ke pɛɛi ye nïn 21 Akɔ̈nythii në aköl Akɔ̈nythii pɛɛi nïn 22. Ku kaci bɛn luel wu 50,000 ke kɔc ke 11 ne northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ci rac, go bany de baai kuɛɛr ku dhɔɔlke lɔ bii ku dhɔ̈l kë bɛn thin thiok thook.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Dhɔɔl kedhie aci ke bɛn thiok thöök agut ɣen thuku l ku ka yene kɔc ke nhim mat thin kedhie aci bɛn thiok yi kura aci bɛn thiok në pɛɛi nin 4 aköldit, ku ke ci rään 100 aci bɛn thou në Italy .

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Ku kä dït ke pol kedhiɛ, nɔŋic yïk kura de thiria A, ake ye ke puɔl ë medän cï thïöök thök agut cë Akɔ̈nydït, lakin ɣɔn ye Kol nïn 9, pol kedhiɛ aacï ke bɛ̈në thiöök thook në të cït tënë pɛn tök.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: Na ɣɔn e Kol nïn 11, go bëny Conte jam ye thiok ke thuɔk ebën thook bi doŋ në yë pan akim yetök. Kë Kol e nïn 6, go thukul de Jaama Anaesthessia Italy, Analgesia, Resuscitation ku Intensive Care (SIAARTI) riëu de thɛ̈nyë cök ë lööŋ ke mɛ̈ɛ̈të yic wɛ̈n lëu bï ke loi wɛl gät bec.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: Në pɛɛi nïn 19 Aköldit, go Italy china waan nom ku ke yene war kɔc ebën në kɔc tuany, ku china ee ci në kɔc ke 3,405 thou panden në korona.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ye Kol nïn 22, go caal kë Russia cë aburuk ke dhoŋuan tuɔc pande Italy bi kë wal laar thin.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: Ku Na ye pɛɛi nïn 5 Bildit ,go kɔc ke 128,948 tuany ku thou kɔc ke 15,887 ku deem kɔc ke 21,815 pande Italy.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Aci CNN luel wu Kɔc ke Italy ku kɔc ke inability aci ke cin ben mat ku bi ke tuany them.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: Akut nom de pialde gup pinyde united kingdom, aci jam ke pɛɛi ye nïn 18 aköldit 2020. në biak de korona  ku kakene kɔc kek British bɛn gam bi kek tuany tiit.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Në yekë, ke akuma acï giit cök në liu de dɔɔr ku cën ke kɔɔr bï ŋic në ke luel juuäc. Në pɛi nïn 16 Akoldöt, bany ye cɔl Boris Johnson acï caal wu caath apal ku thiɔ̈k de yic, ku luel wu bï kɔc ya lui baai ku pääl ɣan ke diɛ̈ɛ̈r, matam ku tëde guɛ̈ɛ̈r.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ye Kol nïn 20, go akuma luel ye ɣɔl wel yene keek loŋ thin te ci ɣe tuany abi keek thiok thook ku dhiit akuma weu tenɔŋ kɔc ka 80% lui kedhia në wëu ke £2,500 në pɛi thok ago cën luɔi gël në ariɛric. Kë Kol e nïn 23, go bëny meecë yic de kɔc caal kë tuc apɛï, thïök kutë nhom cë bak kɔc ka rou nhïm ku mitë keny nyin piny ku kä ye ke loi beec.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Ku yen akuma de Italy ,aci aburuuk toc bi kë kɔc ye ke nhïm mät ya thiic piny.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke duken juɛc aci ke ben thiok thook ,ŋɔl në dukendit ken ku ka thii ken.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: Në kë ye Kön nïn 20, kë COVID-19 tueŋ yök wäläya ë Pinytueŋ Pacific de Washington tënë monyë lɔ dhuk Wuhan ë Kön e nïn 15.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: Ku ɣöt  aa maar aci bɛn looi bene aa kut nom tiɛt nyin në Corona virus mat thin, kë pɛɛi ye nïn 29 Akɔ̈nydit.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 31 Akɔ̈nydit, go bany de pan Amirika ye cɔl Trump, aci kɔc ke china bɛn yɔɔk bï ke ce lɔ Amirika.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: Kë Kön e nïn 28, 2020, go Tëde Gël ë Tuany- kë ye yen amatnhom wat käkë pial ë juör de akuma U.S.- ë cɛɛl lɔn cï kek këdɛnë thëm loi.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Kɔc ke pande United States;  aci kake them bɛn gɔu ku ci kë tuany dɔc them.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: Käk ke thëm aka loi kek në akuma në Akɔ̈nythii, liu da akuma acan bï käk ce kak  ka akuma thaany (kɔc cï piëc, manadhamat ku panakïm) ago cï thök de Akɔ̈nythii ku jal ya kɔc lë bïke ya them ago cï gɔ̈l de Akoldït (Ke bi Dïktoor luel akɔɔr eya).

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ye Nyith nïn 27, go Warɛŋde cɔɔl ë käŋ de Washington caal kë athëm ke 4,000 ë cï loi Amërika.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Në pɛɛi nïn 13 Aköldit, go kɔc ke 14,000 bɛn them gup keke tuany .

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ye Kol nïn 22, akutnhom de e cïk caal: "kɔc juɛc areetic nɔŋ gup kit ke tuany ye kë nyuɔth abi ke them." Bat cïnë thon tueŋ Amërika caal Washington kë Nyith e nïn 29, go Häkïm Jay Inslee caal bë naŋ kɔ̈ɔ̈c de këriëc ëbɛ̈n, e luɔi cï wäläya kɔ̈k bɛ̈në buɔthic.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: Thukuul ke lɔŋde Seattle acë piööc bɛ̈në thiöök thook ɣɔn e Kol nïn 3, ku në Kol cɛlic, kë thukuul ë baiic ëbɛ̈n thiöök. Na ɣɔn ye Kol nïn 6, 2020, gorë Amërika wɛ̈ɛ̈t në akïm ke Jaama de Imperial në wɛ̈të jɔtë rɔt nhial ë rɛ̈ɛ̈cë coronavirus Jöt.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: Ku ne ye kool tok ŋiyic ke bany mac pande U.S. mɛn ye cɔl Trump aci kɔc bɛn miɔc në ka juɛɛc m ku thɛɛny wëu bɛn kɔc kuɔny kë ci wëu kë $8.3 billion.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: Caath aci ben thiok thook ku lɔ tede luɔi ku ye kɔc cɔ lui baai kedhia bi cen raan beer cath.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Käke pol ku wëlë pɛ̈i thook në ruönic aacï ke teemkɔ̈th. Kë Kol e nïn 11, go Trump keny miɛt nyin piny tënë bɛ̈i juëc ke Yurop, liu Britania thïn, në të cït tënë nïn 30, ë jɔɔk kë Kol e nïn 13.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: Në ke niin ke yic ke dhie ke caath aci bɛn thiok në United Kingdom ku Ireland ëya.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛäi nïn 13 Aköldit, go lëk kɔc nan bɛne cɔk kɔc nɔ̈k.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ajöök de arɛ̈k e Kol nïn 15,go ya dukɛn ke kɔn thiöök wälë dhuk kï thää piny U.S. ëbën agorë them bï lathiëi de bairäth cuɔt nyin piny.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: Awel aye Kol nïn 17 , go riäŋë tuany yök në bɛɛi yic ke 50 yic pande Colubia. Ku na ɣɔn e Kol nïn 23, go kɔc ke 10,700 caal pande New York ke tuany në korona bairäth, ëke wär adɛn de kɔc tuany Thauth Koria.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke pɛɛi ye nïn 25 Aköldit, go akuma nyuc pïny ku lëk kɔc bï kɔc yic ya mɛɛi në niin yic ke 2.0 le në niin kë 4.7.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: Në Kol e nïn 28, go kɔc ya 32,308 pan ye cɔl New York city ɣe ke tuany cï yök, ku thou kɔc ke 672 në bairäth. Në Kol e nïn 26, United States aci bɛn caal ke lɔŋ kɔc juëc në pinynhom ebën. Në pɛɛi nïn 8 Bildit 400,335 aci bɛn yök ëya në United States ku thou kɔc ke 12,841.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ye cɔl në kaŋ ne pɛɛi nïn 30 Aköldit, go bany de U.S .mɛn ye cɔl Trump tak bi kɔc ya cɔ mɛɛc yic agut ten pɛɛi nïn 30 Aköldit.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: Ku në ye kool tok ŋiyic, go kɔc ye cɔl USNS pan akim dit lɔŋ  yic ageen ke 1000 loi pan cɔl New York city.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Kë Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 3, go pande U.S. raan 884 caal ke ci thou në korona në thɛɛr yic ke 24.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: Gen New York ic kɔc tuany aacï ɣet raan 100,000 aköll nïïn 3 pɛi Ŋuan. Kɔc lui ɣɔn lööŋ cɔl White House aacï kek jäm gup rin cï kek ke nhïïm dhär tuany ku ku dut wɛ̈t ku lɛ̈k kä akïm ku kɔc käk pinynhom buɔth cök thanthith ku bïk wɛ̈l kɔc ku käk cï gɔ̈t alɔŋ käm ya muk nhïïm ku bïk raan buɔth muɔr-ŋaknhom cɔl Mike Pence ya lɛ̈k.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Go bany ye cɔl Trump kenë kɔc kɛn cï kek kuany bi ke nyin tiet në  piir de panden cɔɔl bi ben mat ke keek.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: Bäny kɔk ke U.S. ku kɔc kɔc jääm nhïïm aacï U.S jääm guöp rin ye kek ke nhïïm täu tën abï tuany thïn, ku ala ic käk bën pan China.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: Caath yene cath në arapbiyat nhial aci bɛn thiok thook në Akɔ̈nydit 2020.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: Në jame ci në jam ɣɔn në ruun de 2018   ë ci luel nan bene lɔ pande wuhan pɔl.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: Ku lɔ pan cɔl Dubai ku Sydney ku Melbourne eya, ë  ci kek luel nan bene ke thiook bi cen raan beer lɔ thin.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: Bali aci bɛn caal ke yen koor në kek yic ke 20 ke nɔŋ adɛt dït në rɔk yic në wɛt de bɛɛi ci nyin tiɛt apieth. ku kɔc ke pande Australia aci ajuɛr bɛn looi bi kë tuany ye cɔl coronavirus Jöt (COVID-19) gel kë Nyith e nïn 7.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: Ku ke ci luel naŋ bɛne kɔk looi në COVID-19, ku Australia aci wutduut keek bɛn thiok thok.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 21 Aköldit,  go ke bi kɔc ci tuany ya nyuɔth pande Australia go bɛi

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: Ku rin cï käk ye juör gäk ke cath pɛ̈ɛ̈n bïk cï cath gen Wuhan ku Hubei, gɛth juëc aacï tak bïk kacken ku kɔcken akuma nyai ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n wën la iic tuany, ku e tiyarat cï juur iic bɛ̈ɛ̈i wïc kacken aa kek cï kek dhɛ̈ɛ̈th, ku luɔi akuma China e wɛ̈t ku bï kek puöl bïk jäl.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: Kɔc ke Canada ku kɔc ke United Statesku  kɔc ke japan, kɔc ke india, kɔc ke sri Lanka,  kɔc ke Australia, ku kɔc ke France, kɔc ke Argentia, kɔc ke Germany ku kɔc  ke Thaila, aci bɛn ya kɔc   tiit areetic në mithken ku nyɛɛike keek në ɣɔl tou tuany kethin .

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: Aci kɔc ke Pakistkan, bɛn lueel yeka cil  raan dä  ci tuany në china.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 7 Akɔ̈nythii, go pan cɔl Brazil go kë rään 34 yök ku matke kenë   kɔc ke ŋuänke china ku indian.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: Kɔc pan Poland, China ku India aacï jäl Poland, të cï tiyara Brazil  kɔ̈ɔ̈c thïn ke kïc guɔ la tueŋ pan Brazil.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: Kɔc ke piny de Brazilian ɣɔn ci lɔ Wuhan aci bɛn tɔ̈u tëde aburuuk.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në ä   kaal tök ŋiyic ke kɔc ye ke cɔl canadians ke 215 (176 në tiɛɛr tueŋi ku kɔc kɔk kë 39 në tiɛɛrde rou yic) aci bɛn tuany ku nyɛɛi yï keek pan cɔl Wuhan ku leer ɣe kek CFB në wiik ke rou yic abac.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: Në pɛi nïn 11 akɔ̈nythii, go kɔc ke 185 kɔc ke  Canadian jal në wuhan lɛkë CFB Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: Kɔc ke pan cɔl Australia, acï kɔc ken 277 jɔt në pɛi nïn 3 ku 4 Akɔ̈nythii lɛkë Christmas Island detention centre mɛn cï liep ke bïnë kɔc ya tɔ̈u thin̈ në nïn ke 14.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: Kɔc ke New Zealand acï thayara tuɔc Auckland në pɛi nïn 5 Akɔ̈nythii; kɔc tɔ̈u në thayara yic (aye kɔc ke Australia ku Pacific) aake cïke ca rɛ̈ɛ̈r të tök në Whangaparoa, nɔŋ tueŋ de Auckland.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 15 Akɔ̈nythii, go kɔc ke United States caal ke tuany ci wende de bany dɔm.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: Ku në pɛɛi nïn 21 Akɔ̈nythii, go tiɛr bɛn ke lɔ ŋic kɔc ke  Canada kɔc ke 129.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: Na ɣɔn aŋoot Akɔ̈nythii ke ken thöök, go akuma de pan de india jam bi kɔc kek nyaai   pande Iran. Kë Kol e nïn 14 go riän nhial de Thauth Aprika cï akuma de Thauth Aprika riɔpic mïth ke panë Thauth Aprika ka 112 dhuök cïen.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: Go ke tuany gɔl në thëm  eten ku wan ke kɔc ke ŋuan ke pande south Africa aci keek bɛn wan në kë nɔŋ keek guɔ̈p tuany.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: Go ya kɔc wel cin guɔ̈p tuany ke pɛi ke pande South Afrika ke palkke keek.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: Ku thëëm de tuany, aci kɔc juëc ke pande South Afrika cï mɛn de thuak, kɔc ke matam, bolith ku jal ya jeec, ke ye biak de gël, aye ŋot ëke ɣooi kek në nïn ke 14 në Ranch Resort.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: Na ɣɔn kë  pɛɛi ye nïn 20 Aköldït, go kɔc ke United States gɔl bi ke kɔc ken nyaai në wɛtde tuany de pinynhom.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: Na ɣɔn kë pɛɛi ye nin 5 Akɔ̈nythii, go bany de chinese,  jam ye kɔc juɛɛc areetic aci wook kuɔny kë cik bɛɛi ke 21 (aye yï Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad ku Tobago, Eqyptku Iran) acï kuɔny tuɔc ̈China.
