sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: Kɔc kɔ̈k ke chinese , miith ke thukuul gɛɛr pan Amirika, aci kɔc ke panden mɛn ye China  bɛ̈n kony në wëu. Ku mïth ke thukuul tɔ̈u në Chicago acï gudhur de 50,000  N95 de alɛ̈th ke kɔc wum yɛ̈ɛ̈k panakïm tɔ̈u në Hubei në pɛi nïn 30 Akɔ̈nydït. Akutnhom de kuɔny kenë ̈FedEx, acï 200,000 alɛ̈th ke wum tuɔc kenë bolomat në pɛi nïn 30 Akɔ̈nydït.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 5 ̈Akɔ̈nythii, gö raan ye cɔl Bill ku Melinda ̈̈̈Gate,  $ 100 million gäm WHO acan benë wal luɔi bɛ̈ɛ̈i ka Afrika ku Asia.

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: Go raan   Lye cɔɔl në ke cɛɛl në keek nan bene masks tëk ke ciï  ka ke 200,000 bi keek tëk kɔc cɔl keek Philipines kë Nyith e nïn 6, bat cï bëny cɔl Richard Gordon masks ka miliön 3.16 lɛr Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke pɛɛi ye nïn 19 Akɔ̈nythii, go akutdhom de pialde guɔ̈p luel ye bi kek gam weu $2.26 million ke ye kuɔ̈ny.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: Pan ye cɔl Japan acï one million de kë yenë wum kum yɛ̈ɛ̈k Wuhan, Turkey acï käk ke panakïm yök ku Russiacï 13 tonnes yɛ̈ɛ̈k Wuhan, Malaysia acï 18 million de bolomat yɛ̈ɛ̈k China, Germany acï 10,000 käk ke panakïm yök ku United States acï 17.8 tons käk ke panakïm yɛ̈ɛ̈k China ku ka cï jam wu bï $ 100 million yɛ̈ɛ̈k bɛ̈ɛ̈i nɔŋic tuany. Ɣɔn cenë tuany dhuk piny, go akuma bɛɛi kɔ̈k kony bɛɛi nɔŋic tuany.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Në Aköldït, kɔc ke china kenë kɔc kë Russia aci kɔk bɛn tuɔc bï në   kɔc ke Italy lɔ kony.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: Raan ë ɣɔc ë käk ye cɔl Jackma aci 1.1 million ke them,ku 6 million de alääth ke kum de wum ku 60,000 aye alɛ̈th ke gël acï gam Addis Ababa, Ethiopia agoke lɔ tek në Africa Union.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: Acï 5,000 käk ke thëm, 100,000 käk kum de wum ku 5 yenë ke wëi  yɛ̈ɛ̈k Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: Ma eya acï käk ke panakïm yɛ̈ɛ̈k Canada. Pan ye cɔl Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia ku Czech Republic acï luel në biak de alɛth ke kum wum ku käk ke thëm.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: Cï mɛn de Spain, acï gudhur de 58,000 käk ke them ëke loi ̈china kek dhuuk cën acan piath den ë 30% abac, ku Netherland acï 600,000 alɛ̈th ke wum dhuɔk cën në rɛɛc kek.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke Belgium, aci ka ke 100,000 yene kɔc ke wum kum bɛn thuɔk nhïïm  ciɛn.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: Në dhöl de, kony de Chinese acï gam në Latin Amerika ku Africa. Në pɛi nin 2 Bild̈it, Bank de pinynhom acï bɛ̈ɛ̈i got ekë yïïk kek miɔc në wëu.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: APMP aci luɔide chinese bɛn dhuɔk alɛc dït në yumde piɔu ku nhiëër .

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: Akut nom de pialde guɔ̈p ye cɔl WHO acï käk wuɔ̈ɔ̈inë tuany de 2002-2004 SARS ɣɔn cïnë akuma de China riëc kɔ̈u wu kën yic luel ku tuany de ye mɛnë cïnë Akuma kɔc lɛ̈k dhɔ̈ɔl ke gël ago cën riɔc në Lunar New York.

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 23 Akɔ̈nydit, në biak de ke cï luel benë caath thök thook në Wuhan, ke bany de WHO ye cɔl Gauden Galea acï jam wu ka piɛth ekë cï loië acaka mɛn ëkenë ye luel në WHO, acan eye nyuɔɔth de gɛm de rɔt ago tuanyë gël bï rɔt cë thiëi piny. Në pɛi nïn 30 Akɔ̈nydït, ɣɔn cenë ye yök ke ye wuɔɔk në raan dɛ̈t guɔp ku cï adɛt rɔt dhit, go WHO caal ke ye tuany de pinynhom ëbɛn. (PHEIC), ke de dhetem de PHEIC mïn në 2009 në thɛɛr ke swine flu.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: Aci banyda kut nom de pialde guɔ̈p ye cɔl WHO, aci bɛn jam yë PHEIC bɛn tuɔc pan cï nic akut nom de pialde guɔ̈p.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: Kë cï tak rin bï la keny gɛ̈l, acï Tedros luel " acïn wɛ̈tde ic tën käk awën la keny ku ɣɔɔc wei pinynhom" ku WHO ace ɣɔɔc pinynhom  ku cäth dhuök piny."

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 5 Akɔ̈nythii, go APMP lɛk kɔc ke piny nom bi kë miɔc në miliöön ka $675 bï ke juar kubï ajuɛɛrë röt löï tënë bɛ̈i cën wëu, ku luel dac kuny e bi kä wɛ̈n "cën bɔnh de luɔi tɔ̈ bïnë kɔc cë wuɔɔk në kɔ̈m ya nyic acɔkä lɔnë bï yën tul".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: Tedros aci bɛn jam ku luelke ye wɔ ci riɛr areetic në ke ci wɔ tuany cɔl Covid-19 bɛn tiam. Në pɛi nïn 11 Akɔ̈nythii, WHO acï tuany cäk ke ye cɔl COVID-19.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: Na ɣɔn në ye kool tokŋi yic, go   rään mac UN go  lɛk kɔc bi kɔc kedhia ke pinynhom këdhiac kuɔny.

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: Go Akutnhom ë Mɛ̈c de UN jɔt  nhom në wɛ̈t e kënë, ku cɔkë mɛ̈të cin de Akutnhïïm ë bï ë bɛ̈n gam, ë ye bi ke APMP puöl bë "bë ye nhom täu në luɔi de käkë pial kë dutuuc kɔ̈k kä lëu bïk riɛldɛn täu ago aririr ke lɔ thiëi bec de tuany në baŋde määl, yïŋde lɔtueŋ ku jɔla ciɛŋ de kɔc".

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 14 Akɔ̈nythii, ke kɔc ke WHO ku kɔc ke china, aci bɛn nyuc piny bi kë tuany gël ke ŋoot kë ken dit areetic te nɔŋ kɔc ku ŋoot ke ken pinydhom ebën yöök. Në pɛi nïn 25 Akɔ̈nythii, WHO acï pinynhom ebɛ̈n yök wu bïkë rɔ̈th juiir në bɛ̈n de tuany de pinynhom cɔl koronavirus, acï luel eya wu cï bï go cɔl tuany de pinynhom, dolat alë bïkë tau eke cï rɔ̈t juiir.

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: Aŋoot tuany ke ken  dɔm areetic go akutnhom de pialde guɔ̈p ye cɔl WHO tuɔc pande Iran bi keek lɔ kuɔny në tïet bɛn ne tuany tiit. Në pɛi nïn 28 Akɔ̈nythii, WHO acï luel wu bï tuany koric agot tïŋ dït amath wenë dït areetic.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: Go bany Mike Ryan de  akutnhom de pialde guɔ̈p ye cɔl WHO në pïny thook ebën cɔl Mike Ryan, go luel packe  ku tiet ku nyin në tuany.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: Ku yen tuany kenë arac areet ku ka pieth bi gël ke ken  guɔ rac areetic.

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: Ku bany ye cɔl Ryan, aci bɛn jam ye tuany kenë abï rään ebën dhiil dɔm ne pinynhom ebën, ku acï luel lɔn ka cɛl cï yen cal alɛ̈u bï luel lɔn "ka ok ayeku gam lɔn ka kuat raan tɔ̈u pinynhom abï köm dhiɛl la ye guöp.

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 11 Akoldït, go akutnhom de pialde guɔ̈p luel ye korona virus aci thiic ne pinynhon eben.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: Acï bäny luel wu WHO acï diɛr në thiëi piny de tuany ku jal ya liu de kë loi. WHO acï git cök ku luel wu kën tuany gël apiɛth, cï mɛn ɣɔn cɔɔl yen tuany de pinynhom ke cï gaau ku jal ya bï tuany tau ke ye këde pinynhom ëbɛn.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nin dhetem pende ŋuan, go bany cɔl Tedros Adhan kɔc luoi kɔc ke 733,000 mënë ye Akɔ̈nydït nïn 6.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 26 Akoldït 2020, go kɔc ke UN luel bi ke ye cɔl yic de rään dhil tɔu ku bï COVID-19 gël.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: Acï kɔ̈k luel we raan ebɛ̈n anɔŋ lɔ̈ŋ bï kɔny ku lui kenë eke da ̈akuma.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: Akut nom de pialde guɔ̈p aci bɛn jam ye cɛn käŋ aci kɔc bi yïï atëk thok .

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: Kɔ̈k cï piëc arët aye jam wu raan ebɛ̈n anɔŋ yic de pial de guɔp, ago cï kɔc niɔp, kɔc liik, kɔc cï dhiɔp, kɔc cï cuɔp wei baai, kɔc cïn baai, kɔc nɔŋ piir raac, kɔc cï maac ku jal ya abaköök ku kɔ̈k kɔɔr kuɔny kenë akuma.

sourceString: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
targetString: Akuma mac pinynhom aci  bene yɔɔk be piir de ka cam keek cɔ dit ago tuany ye cɔl COVID-19 kɔc ci nak ku cɔk.

sourceString: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
targetString: Ku ka ci  akutnhom  mac piir de  piny nom , aci kɔc jääm në piir bene piir a piir ee ci niɔp  areetic baŋ de ka camkë .

sourceString: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
targetString: Në lɔ̈ŋ cïke tau bïkë panakïm ku tajir ca ril në biak wan cenë käŋ thök thook, ke jöt cï mɛn de lɔ̈ŋ ke dola benë käŋ ya kɔɔr, ku ka kɔɔr benë kɔc röth piööc  ku benë kak nan në biak de coronavirus ya loi.

sourceString: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
targetString: Go akuma de china yɔɔk në kɔc ke United s States ku kɔc ke UK go luel ye thɛmke bukku ye tuany ci bɛn ne china bukku gel.

sourceString: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
targetString: Ku kɔc juɛc ke akuma de china ye cɔl (CPC)aci keek bɛn nyaai në luɔi yic can cie  ke kɔc ci tuany ya cɔ tɔu në ɣöt ken yic.

sourceString: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Ku ka ci kɔc kɔk bɛn gam ,ye yekene ë looi bi kɔc kuɔny në china,  cï mɛnde bäny yii ary Xi Jinpin bi keek kuny në mat yë kɔc ke nhïïm mät.

sourceString: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
targetString: Kɔc kɔk ke chinese;  ci mɛn de raan cɔl Zhao Lijiana, aci jaai luel ye tuany ye cɔl COVID-19 ee bɔ  pan cɔl U.S, ku pan cɔl Italy.

sourceString: The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".
targetString: Go akuma de U.S mɛn ŋɛɛr raan cɔl Donald Trump luel kɔ̈m de korona ya cɔl ke ye "kɔ̈m China" wula "kɔ̈m Wuhan" kë ye luel "akuën de China acë kɔ̈m cɔla lathiëi piny yen cë jä bɛ̈n kë ye tuany de piny ebɛ̈n", ku aacï kɔc juëc tïŋ keye tɛ̈t rot ku "e kuöc luɔide rac ic bï tuany cï lëu gɛ̈l."

sourceString: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
targetString: Ajuiir de Daily Beast acï akuma de U.S. yök bï wël ya luel biɛ ku ka cïkë gɔl cök tënɔŋ akutnhom eë nyin tït në baai, ku ka nɔŋ kedɛn cï gɔɔr wu kë riëëc ëbɛ̈n ë china.

sourceString: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
targetString: Ok aacï kek yɔ̈ɔ̈k ku buk them ku buk thoŋkën dhiɛl luɛl aɣer kuat dhɛ̈l bï yen rot lɛ̈u, ku ala ic jam kek kɔc wɛ̈l luɛl aɣer ku tilbithiön nyin."Ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n jam cïmen Politiko, Löŋ pandɛ̈t, ku acï Bloomberg luel lɔn ka China abuöc ku bï kuɔny tuɔc tën bɛ̈ɛ̈i cï tuany dɔm thïn ku e të wïc kek yen bïk rɔ̈t wɛc piny thïn.

sourceString: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
targetString: Ku na ɣɔn ɣe ka ci bënyde EU cɔl Josep Borrel bɛn luel ye ka ci ke bi luel ne ke ci ne tuany bɛn ne piny nom eben.

sourceString: Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
targetString: Borrell aci bɛn dhiaac ke luelka juɛc luel ye china aci thön laar bïi areetic.

sourceString: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
targetString: China acï US yök ye bï kë cen Syria , Venezuela ku Iran  kuum nyaai, ke got ke gɛm miɔ̈ɔ̈c tenɔŋ bɛɛi ka rou.

sourceString: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke raan cɔɔl Jack Ma aci 100,000 masks bɛn yook ye tok ke pɛɛi ye nïn 3 Bildït go US ke pën.

sourceString: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke U.S aci ke bɛn thic thök në ke yekë kuɔy kaar në bɛɛi kɔk yic ku pande.

sourceString: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
targetString: Ku alɛɛth yene kɔc ke wum kum thöŋ në ka tou në  bɛɛi kɔk yic yi Germany ku Austria aci ke bɛn tek.

sourceString: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
targetString: Ku në ye kenë yic ke kɔc ke  Turkey aci kɔc ke Spain bɛn köny në kɔk.

sourceString: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pende diäk guɔ akuma de pan cɔl italy, kɔc kë European leec atreetic në kuny cï keke kony.

sourceString: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
targetString: Aci bany cɔl maurizio Massari mɛn yene ambassada piny de EU,k aci bɛn luel ye  ka yë chines ke kä nɔŋ ke nyin kë .

sourceString: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
targetString: Ku Në yïc adil,   ke aburuuk aci ke bɛn kek nyic na yekë European.

sourceString: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 22 Aköldit, go bany de pan cɔl Italy cööt në jaath kenë banyde Russian, ago aburuuk tuɔc bi ke wal laar pande Italian.

sourceString: Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".
targetString: Ku bany de Italy, aci bɛn jam luel wu kony yene wɔ kuɔny në 80 ë buɔɔtic në kɔc ke Russia akoor ku ka ci ke kony.

sourceString: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
targetString: Ku tiet ye  ne keka kë bɛn thïn, aci kɔckë Russoa bɛn guɛl.

sourceString: The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
targetString: Gö banyde Lombardy ku banyde Italy,  go kë kɔc yë cɔɔl në käkë baai nyuɔth ku leec ke roth.

sourceString: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
targetString: Ku kɔc kë Russia, aci tiɛr bɛn toc bi lɔ pande United States kene wal ku kɔk köny nyike.

sourceString: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."
targetString: Kremlin ë cɛɛl cɔl Dmitry Peskov ecë luel lɔna "gɛmë kony tënë määth kuan ke US, [Putin] e ye thɔ̈ŋic të le kɔc ë US e käke wɛl guɔ̈r ku aduɔt kɔ̈k röt la cɔ̈k piny, ka lëu bïk bɛ naŋ ke be kï kony na lëu rot."

sourceString: The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.
targetString: Ku ke ci bany de Germany NATO"mac aburuuk 2020"luel  ye wec bi thɔ̈r në ye tuany cie bene ku thärku ci tɔŋ kɔk yukku ke looi.

sourceString: The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.
targetString: Bany de döm ë dhɛ̈ŋ ye cɔl Kate Hudson acï lui de dugëël 2020 dhɔ̈lic: në biak de pial de guɔp, ke kenë ace jeec de US ku European yen nɛ̈k, e dolat lui ke thïn ebɛ̈n. Akuma de Iran acï ë tuanyë riɔɔk aret, anɔŋ kɔc ke rou ke baranaman cï tuany ku jal ya kɔc kɔ̈k ke thieer ku dhic.

sourceString: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.
targetString: Mɔɔr ŋak nhom de pan ye cɔl Iran, Hassan Rouhani acï athöör gaar tenɔŋ bäny ke pinynhom ke kɔɔr kuɔny në pɛi nïn 14 Akoldït 2020, acï luel wu pande athaar kenë tuany yetök ku ka cïn kuɔny në wɛ̈t nɔŋë Iran tɔŋ kenë United States. Tuanyë acï United States ca löm löŋ ke bɛɛi cï kuɛth cï mɛn de panakïm, akïm de mïth ku jal ya gël de tuany.

sourceString: Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.
targetString: Ku ka ci thiɛthn dit ke Amirika bɛn luel wu ye tuanyi abi cuet de 2020 riɔk te nɔŋ raan mac  panda Amirika, mɛn ye cɔl Donald Trump.

sourceString: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.
targetString: Kɔc ke South koriya aci Japan ke bɛn yɔɔk ye raan ye bɛn ebën abï ya cɔ tou në nin ke thieer ku ŋuan ama wiik ke rou  pan akim.

sourceString: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke pan cɔl South koriya, aci piooth bɛn riak ne jam ci banyde mac baai jam.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.
targetString: Kɔc jueec ke South korea aaca athɔ̈r göt lɔn bï kek Moon cop rin ke yeke luel lɔn cï akuma tuany kuöc gɛ̈l, wula bïk këden cï looi lec. Tuany acï gɛth juëc cɔl aabï lööŋ nhial ku bï ke tuany gɛ̈l.

sourceString: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
targetString: Ku kɔc juɛɛc ye kɔc kuɔny në jääm aci bɛn jam në akuma de baai. Ku luɛl kek yen yë tuany abi kɔc gäm Alɔjeth.

sourceString: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
targetString: Pan Hungary, bärlamande aacï cuɛt ku bïk prime miniɛter, Viktor Orban, puöl ku bï kuum tëcït të cï yen cal thïn, ku bï bärlaman thiök thok ku kuaany bai ku kuum kɔc lueth tɛk piny alɔŋ köm ku të ye akuma kë jɔ̈ɔ̈r bai luɔi thïn.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
targetString: Ku ye tuany cɔl korona, aci bɛn gɔk në wɛɛr ci piir de piny nom ebën cɔ niop ku dhiɛc ke riir kɔc kedhia në gel bene ye gel.

sourceString: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
targetString: Ku na ɣɔn ke pan de United States kene kɔc ye cuïn bɛi bɛn gɔk kene kɔc ye wal bɛi.

sourceString: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
targetString: Piny juëc acï ya ɣɔ̈c ëke riɔ̈c në thök benë käŋ thök thuuk cï mɛn de kuïn, waragɛk de bakana, piu ke marɔprɔp, ku jal ya liu de kë bï bɛr bɛ̈i.

sourceString: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
targetString: Ku ciirkäi ku kɔc ye luui në ka ke riiŋ, ci mɛn arabiyat aci ke bɛn yɔɔk ye na lakke gaw ke  we bi ke nyaai tëde luoi.

sourceString: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
targetString: Bany de kɔc ka kutnhom de pialde guɔp ee ci jam bi raan ebën rɔt ya tiit në tuany ye tok acë rɔt jɔt në käŋ ka 100.

sourceString: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
targetString: Ku yekene aci në ka yekë ɣac ebën bɛn gal thukul ku jal kaŋ rac areetic në kɔc cin.

sourceString: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke ka yeneke roth tiit aci yic bɛn riɛr në yöök ku luel APMP ye kɔc ke luɔi kedhia aci lolden looi.

sourceString: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
targetString: Ku ka ci keek bɛn yin nomlääu agoke  kake ya lɔ ɣaac china.

sourceString: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke ye ke looi kedhia , aci kɔc bɛn ya cɔ nak miith thin koor areetic në thukic, ku ka kenë akuma pande Austria bɛn nhiäär. Acɔka lɔnë cï käkë COVID-19 bɛ̈n nhial lɔŋde Cumal Italy ku jɔla pande Wuhan, ku lɔnhial dït ë wïnyë käŋë cäm, kekë ɣän kä keröu acë mïïth ke yic dak.

sourceString: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
targetString: Käk cï China ku Italy looi bï kek lui tujaria kek aacï tiam, luɔi bï miɛ̈th cï liu cïmen cï yen  thɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ ic Ɣurupa ku Amerika piny tueŋ.

sourceString: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
targetString: Kɔc ke Northern Italy, kenë kä kɛn ka kë pɔɔr de rap  , aci kä ci looi.

sourceString: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke ɣan yene kacamke tɔ̈u ake ci e ben në luoi thaa ɣɔn center tuany dɔm në Wuhan në china.

sourceString: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
targetString: Ku lööŋ kɔc ye käŋ ɣac ake thɔny në lööŋ ke pande Italy.

sourceString: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
targetString: Ku riäk de piir de piny nom ebën aci bɛn riak areetic ku ka gɔl root në china në pɛ̈i tueŋ kerou de 2020. Në pɛi nïn 16 Akoldït ke ka cï luel wu cï thuuk de China rïäk ku lɔ ɣɛc piny 20.5% në buɔtic.

sourceString: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
targetString: Cɔk alɔn ye mainland China pan ajak ku të ye kɔc döök thïn, ka tuany kën acï tïŋ ke rɛc jiɛk pinynhom.

sourceString: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
targetString: Agathe Demarais keye raan lui alɔŋ jiɛk baai  acï luel lɔn bï thuök rɛ̈ɛ̈r ke la dɛ̈kdɛ̈k ɣet dhaman bï käŋ rɔ̈t cök piny të le yen kë puɔth bɔ̈ bei thïn.

sourceString: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në Kön ic 2020, go piir riak ci mɛn ci ke ɣɔn de 2002-2004  ɣɔn ce ne SARS dɔm.

sourceString: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke thukul cɔl St.louis aci 300 billion bɛn gam kɔc ke piny nom ke ye kuɔnyden.

sourceString: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
targetString: Manadhama de jaath (OPEC) awel në jath laar në wutdbɛɛi pei yic, aci bɛn thiok.

sourceString: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në pɛɛi nïn 24 Akɔ̈nythii, ke käŋ aci bɛn lɔ nhial areet thuk në wɛtde COVID-19.

sourceString: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.
targetString: Kë Nyith e nïn 27, 2020, ke kɔc aci bɛn diɛɛr në korona virus në bɛn ce bɛn,  go käke ɣɛc baŋde U.S. nɔŋic yïk NASDAQ-100, S&P 500  Index, ku jɔla Dow Jones de cirgɛt acë cindɛnë ɣɛc tɔ̈ piny mënë 2008, kekë Dow ë lɔ piny ne 1,191, ë ye yene  dhuk dït në köl tök ic mɛ̈në 2007-2008 le käk e ɣɛɛc piny.

sourceString: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
targetString: Ku kake diak ake ci ne ke juaac wär 10%.

sourceString: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
targetString: Në pɛi nïn 28 Nyith, go kënë them ye cɔl GmbH ecë athëm de riɛlë yic pande China gam, ku ŋot kë cë ye tïŋ apiɛth.

sourceString: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
targetString: Ku kɔc aci bɛn riɔc areetic në korona virus ke pɛɛi ye nïn 16 Akoldït.

sourceString: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
targetString: Kɔc juëc aci piir de  piny nom nhiaar bɛn rɔt ci gär ku wɛɛr rot.

sourceString: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
targetString: Ku kɔc ke duken aci kɔc ke bɛn de piny nom bɛn wɛɛt bi kɔc ya miɔc në weu gut ëë  thaa.

sourceString: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
targetString: Bɛɛŋ de piny nom ebën ake bɛn gau ci ke ɣɔn de 2008.

sourceString: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
targetString: Ku kɔc ye bɛn në ɣɔl kɔk keke bi bɛn dai në ka ke piny pei ku kɔc ye cath në bɛɛi kɔk yic ke ka ci bɛn tuany areetic në piny nom ebën.

sourceString: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
targetString: Ka mɛn yeneke kät nhial aliiric aci ke bɛn thiok ebën bi ci rään bɛn caath cï mɛn de British Airways, China Eastern Airlines ku Qantas, ku British airline.

sourceString: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
targetString: Ku ye aci  ciirkai ku thuk uul de jath be riɔk awar tan thɛɛrden.

sourceString: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
targetString: Ɣön juɛɛc yenë kɔc kë piɔc ku metɛɛr, aci keek bɛn thiok thook.

sourceString: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
targetString: Ku yen ye tuanyi, aci ruɔn gidiit bɛn nyaai në kɔc piöth ku ajathaa.

sourceString: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
targetString: Kak juëc cï mɛn de bï kɔc määt nhom në akuma, cï mɛn de miɛth de piɔu de thök ruɔn, ku manadhamat ëke cï dhukän thök ku jal ya ɣan nɔŋ kak yenë ke daai tɔ̈u në Hong Kong ku Shangai Disneyland.

sourceString: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke yal dit de miɛtde picu ye looi në thök ruun aci  bɛn nyaai ago kɔc ke nhim ci mät tetok.

sourceString: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
targetString: Në  pɛɛi nïn 24 pande china,   go 31 në ɣɔ̈n yene kɔc ke mat ku holiday de ruun jidiit cuɔt agut ɣen pɛɛi nïn 10 Akɔ̈nythii.

sourceString: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
targetString: Go ke 80% de bɛɛi kɔk ci GDP cɔl bɔ thin ku cɔkke 90% lɔ bii.

sourceString: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
targetString: Ku genë Hong Kong acï dhɔ̈ɔ̈l yeke tuany gɛ̈l juak nyïïn ku acï baai cɔl athiök thok, thukuul aacï thiöök thook ɣet cë Kol ku yan jɔ̈k cök ruon acï tem kɔ̈u. Kɔc kom wei aacï këdït yɔ̈k pinynhom ebën, dhuk piny de thää ye kɔc ɣɔɔc wei wula thiök thok kamthin kor.

sourceString: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
targetString: Lɛmde kɔc aci bɛn looi ne Euope ku Latin Amirika në gudhur de 40%.

sourceString: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
targetString: Ku North ̈̈Amirika ku Middle East  lɔŋ tagiirii nɔŋ  kaŋ ke 50-60% bɛn yök.

sourceString: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
targetString: Ku yekene aci cathde kɔc cök bɛn dhiëc gɔl në ke ci raan 33-43% keke lɔ ɣɔ̈c thuk në Akɔ̈nythii ic.

sourceString: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke ka ci bɛn luel ye ɣɔc bene raan ya lɔ ku loom ke kɔɔr ku jen kenë yen leer panden wenë pande. Tenɔa United Nations, ke ka ye luel wu gudhur de 14 ku 22 million atɔ̈u në cokic në Latin Amerika në wɛ̈t de ye tuanyë.

sourceString: In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
targetString: Në Kön ku Nyöth ic 2020, ɣɔn ci tuany dit pande Wuhan dɔm kɔc ke 5 million pinyde china, go kɔc kɔk loiloi ken wan.

sourceString: Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.
targetString: Ku kɔc juɛ̈c ke china, ake cin bɛn thiɔŋ bi ke lɔ në 300 milion kɔc ke bɛɛi pei acï kɛk në Inland tɔ̈u në Hubei. Në pɛi de Akoldït, raan gudhur de 10 million ka Amerika acë luɔi ke riak ku ka cï akuma bɛr lim.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.
targetString: Lɔ bii de Korona virus, abi cɔ lɔ në 47 million pan ye cɔl United States ku 32% acï caal në baŋ de St. Louis. Pan ye cɔl India anɔŋ mallion ke thiëër rɛ̈ɛ̈r baai. Acï Angus Reid luel wu gudhur de 44% pan ye cɔl Canada. 900,000 de kɔc acï bɛr lui pande Spain mënë thïökë cäth thok në Kol yic cɛlic 2020.

sourceString: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.
targetString: Na ɣɔn në biak de Akoldït,  go kɔc ke luɔi ke  yöök ke 4 million pande French ku 1 million ë kɔc ë lui pande Britain ake cë gɛ̈t ɣöt bïk dëën. Akuma de Germany acï kɔc ke yɛ̈ɛ̈k nïn bike rɛ̈ɛ̈r baai në ajuiɛr ye cɔl Kurzar beit.

sourceString: The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
targetString: Gõ kɔc ke Germany, thaa thin në lɔm, ku bi ke daai në te yene Britain ka ken luɔithin.

sourceString: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
targetString: Ɣan yenëke nyic nyuɔth ku ka thɛɛr ke ceŋ acï tuanyë ëke riɔɔk, acï manadhamat ku piir de kɔc riɔɔk- kɔc cï luɔi ku kɔc ë kɔc lui ë pinynhom ebɛ̈n.

sourceString: Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.
targetString: Go manadhamai ye kɔc kuny ke nhiim mat ku takke ke bi rään ebën cɔ leu rɔt. Tuanyë acï kanitha ku thukuul ku ɣän ke kura ca thök thook.

sourceString: By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.
targetString: Na Aköldit ruun de 2020, go ke rieec ebën thiok thook ku nyaai kä achiɛk ye kɔc kä kën lui thin ci mɛn de diɛɛr de lɔ̈ɔ̈r.

sourceString: In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.
targetString: Në dhuk de nhom de ke ka nɔŋ ka cïke loi në biak de cëk. Dɛ̈t eya cï rɔt loi në ye tuanyë yic aye ɣan ke kanitha ke ka cïke thök, ka juëc ke kura, ku ɣän ke guër, cï mɛn de diɛ̈r de lɔ̈ɔ̈r, ku tëde nyooth da alath.

sourceString: The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
targetString: Ku Ɣön yeneke ka ke daai looi aci ke bɛn thiok thook ebën, ku cɔɔl ɣe këde kool na  jik pande Rome,  ɣɔn jal bɛn nyic në kool aa këër ku dhiɛc ke nyaai ɣe kerethanooi  kek pɛi.   në wɛtde tuany.

sourceString: Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.
targetString: Ku Diocese juɛc aci kerethanooi bɛn yɔɔk bi kë tɔu baai ku ci ke ben lɔ kanitha në kool de läät. Ku yekke lɔŋ në internet nyin ku Radios cök.

sourceString: With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.
targetString: Ku rin cï kanitha Roman Katholik Diocese thiök ku ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc rɔ̈ɔ̈k thïn ku kanitha wɛ̈ndhɛ̈ŋ Piter acïn raan cï bën la bï rɔ̈ɔ̈k thïn, Krithano juëc aacï loiloi ken tem kɔ̈th ku aacï akutnhomden cɔl akor ic kanitha ic, mosijit, yokolo, yïk ku gurdwaras.

sourceString: Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.
targetString: Go banyde pialde guɔp pande Iran, caal luel ye ka ci raan lɔ kanitha në koolde lɔ̈ŋ në yum jima ku ɣän tou tuany ke thin kedhia.

sourceString: The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
targetString: Tuany acï aguiɛr riäŋ pinynhom jɔ̈ɔ̈r mɛ̈nɛ̈ tɔŋdït pinynhom ye kek rɔu.

sourceString: Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.
targetString: Käk riäŋ kek dït aacï kek puöl kam kor wula aacï kek tem kɔ̈th, ku aala ic aguiɛr kura pan ɣurupa ruon 2019-20 ye cɔl UEFA Champions league, ku Premier 2019-20, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019-20 NBA, ku 2019-20 NHL.

sourceString: The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.
targetString: Lathiëi bec e tuanyë aca juɛr ë bï Olympik loi në kër dë 2020, kë ye kënë cï täu bï ya thök de Alɛthbor; Akutnhom ë Pinynhom de Olympik e cïk caal ke Kol e nïn 24 lɔn bïnë nïn ajuɛr bɛ "dhuök në luɔi në nïn tɔ̈ tueŋ në 2020 ku ka cë lëu bïkï bɛ bak në kërë 2021 ic." Kathinoth ku ɣän ke riäŋ kɔ̈k ke pinynhom aacë thïök ku kuthena ye ke riääŋ aacï ke calë kë kääc wälë cï ke teem kɔ̈th.

sourceString: This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.
targetString: Ku kën acï kɔc mek cɔl aa köök webthaith kɔ̈u, ku aacï kɔc muk ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n webthaith ye kɔc mek thïn luel lɔn cï kɔc juëc gɛ̈t piny thïn tën kek. Ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n kɔc gaat nyïïn aacï kek jɔ̈ɔ̈r aya, ku akut ye kɔc gut thïn waak aacï loiloi ken puol wula aacï cäthde tem kɔ̈u.

sourceString: Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
targetString: Ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc lui thïn video cïmen Broadway acï loiloi ken puöl kam kor.

sourceString: Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.
targetString: Ku apanään juëc aacï dhɔ̈ɔ̈l kök yɔɔp bï kek waak gut ku rɔm kä kek kɔc kök internet ic keye dhëldeɛ̈t ye kek ket, cïmen luide internet wula keye luɔi webthaid "yiɛ̈th" ku bï apanään ye ket thïn, bïk waak tek ku nyuɔth kä luɔiden.

sourceString: Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
targetString: Ku kɔc aci ka juɛɛc ke dɔl ber ya lɔ tau në tuany cɔl korona virus ke ye ke ci kɔc kueth.

sourceString: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.
targetString: Mɛ̈nɛ̈ a jɔ̈k COVID-19, go mään kɔc tuany jɔk, tɛ̈t rot, ku jiɛm guop aacï ke tïŋ tën kɔc pan China ku kɔc piny cuɛ̈ɛ̈c ye cɔl Athia, ku ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n la iic tuany ɣurupa, United States ku bɛɛi kök.

sourceString: Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.
targetString: Käk rɛc cïmen riɔ̈ɔ̈c, diu puou,ku rɛ̈ɛ̈c dït aacï ke tïŋ bɛ̈ɛ̈i juëc iic, ka aa bɛ̈ɛ̈i ɣurupa, kɔc piny cuɛ̈ɛ̈c cɔl Athia, Amerika tueŋ, ku piny Athia.

sourceString: Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.
targetString: (cïmen ŋuɔt ye kɔc tuany juëc yɔ̈k pan China) Tɛ̈t rot kam kɔc juëc China cï wer pinynhom lɔn le kek gup köm wula lɔn yɔ̈k kek tɛ̈t rot keye gur rin kë cïk wuöc.

sourceString: Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
targetString: Ku bɛɛi kɔk ke panda Afrika, aci  ka juɛc manë kek pande china bɛn tïŋ.

sourceString: Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
targetString: Ku kɔc juëc ke pan cɔl Wuhan ku Hubeiaaci ka juɛc ka tek  thok bɛn tiŋ në kenë gɔc e tuany roth panden.

sourceString: There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.
targetString: Anaŋ kuɔny tën kɔc pan China, internet ic ku aɣer, ku kɔc rɛ̈ɛ̈r ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n la iic tuany.

sourceString: Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, could also be subjected to suspicion and xenophobia.Citizens in countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea initially signed petitions lobbying to ban Chinese people from entering their countries in an effort to stop the disease.
targetString: Mɛ̈nɛ̈ gɔl tuany rot bɛ̈ɛ̈i kök yam iic, kɔc pan Italy, pan tueŋ ɣurupa cï tuany COVID-19 kaŋ jɔt thïn, ala ic diu puou, ku tɛ̈t rot. Kɔc pan ̈Malathia, New Zealand, Singapore, ku Korea alɔŋ ciɛ̈n (South) aaci athɔ̈r thany ic ku bï kɔc pan China  cï ben la bɛ̈ɛ̈i ken iic ku naŋ të gël kek tuany.

sourceString: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan trended on Twitter.
targetString: Pan Japan, kë cï gɔ̈t twitter ic #KɔcpChinaDuökäBɔ̈Japan

sourceString: Chinese people as well as other Asians in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse, as well as assaults.
targetString: Kɔc pan China ku kɔc bɛ̈ɛ̈i Athia kök tɔ̈u pan Diŋlith (United Kingdom) ku Amerika (United States) aacïk luel lɔn cï tɛ̈t rot ku luöc ku nääk rot ye nyin juak.

sourceString: U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.
targetString: Muɔrŋaknhom pan  Amerika Donald Trump acï kɔc juëc apɛi jäm guop rin cï yen coronavirus cɔl keye "köm pan China", ku aacï kɔc luel lɔn ye yen jam rac kɔc pan China gup ku e tɛ̈t rot.

sourceString: Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.
targetString: Kɔc ke cï puöth riääk pan Ukraine aacï kɔc Ukraine ke ɣɛ̈ɛ̈c thurumbiil gɛ̈ɛ̈m ku kɔc ke nyɛi gen Wuhan le Novi Sanzhary.

sourceString: Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Mïïth abuun ke buɔ India alɔŋ tueŋ, rɔm akeu kek China, ka aa kuën gɛth dït India iic aacïk luel lɔn cï kuöc ciëŋ rin tuany cï rot thääny kek jɔ̈k cök coronavirus.

sourceString: The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
targetString: Kɔc akut Baratiya tɔ̈u Bengal Dilip ̈Ghosh Ciɛm aacik luel lɔn cï kɔc pan China käk cï cak rac ku "e yen cï Nhialic gur looi tën kek."

sourceString: The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".
targetString: Wɛ̈l cï rɔ̈t luel kä aacï raan muk nyin bëny pan China pan Kolkata maan ku luel "kä lueth". Tuany acï tɛ̈t rot ye kɔc pan China tet cɔl a dït nyïn, ku kɔc pandɛ̈t aacï kek ya cɔl "kɔc anyuɔn" ku aaye ke wïc bï kek puök wei.

sourceString: Many newspapers with paywalls have removed them for some or all of their coronavirus coverage.
targetString: Athɔ̈ɔ̈r juëc yeke wɛ̈lyam cal thïn aacïk nyai tëden ye kek coronavirus cal thïn.

sourceString: Many scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with open access.
targetString: Ku kɔc gɛ̈t käk pinynhom ye cɔl thanythith aacï athɔ̈ɔ̈r loi thääny thook kek tuany cɔl aaye raan ebën tïŋ ku kuen kek.

sourceString: Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.
targetString: Thanythith juëc aacïk tak bïk kä ken cïk yɔ̈k lac rɔm kek kɔc alɔŋ ye kɔc gät thïn cïmen bioRxiv.

sourceString: Emerging infectious disease – Infectious disease of emerging pathogen, often novel in its outbreak range or transmission mode
targetString: Tuany kɔc lac dɔm cï bën- Tuany kɔc lac dɔm cï bën la ic köm, tuany puɔc jɔk wula të ye yen rot tɛk piny thïn.

sourceString: Globalization and disease – Overview of globalization and disease transmission
targetString: Pinynhom ku tuany- Të ye pinynhom tiëŋ thïn ku të tuany rot tɛ̈k piny thïn.

sourceString: List of epidemics and pandemics – A list of death tolls due to infectious disease
targetString: Athɔ̈r cï tuɛnytuɛny ku juɛ̈ŋden rot gät piny thïn- Athɔ̈r kɔc cï thou acï rot juak rin tuany kɔc dɔm.

sourceString: Wildlife smuggling and zoonoses – Health risks associated with the trade in exotic wildlife
targetString: Dömdöm lääi rɔɔr ku lääi mac adika ic-käk jɔ̈ɔ̈r pial guop ic thiäk thook kek lääi rɔɔr ye ɣaac wei.

sourceString: Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.
targetString: Ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc them gup thïn e tuany coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) ku tuany cɔl SARS-CoV-2 acï dhɔ̈ɔ̈l yeke köm ku käk bën bei köm guop tïŋ mat thïn.

sourceString: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus'  RNA.
targetString: Rɛ̈ɛ̈r käm riim iic aye tïŋ RT-PCR, ku e kuat coronavirus' RNA.

sourceString: This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Athɛ̈m kën aloi thok ku acï guir bï ya kuat kɔ̈mde RNA de SARS-CoV-2 yen ye tïŋ.

sourceString: It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
targetString: Aye luɔ̈i ku bï tuany lui guop ic emɛ̈nɛ̈ thiin tïŋ.

sourceString: Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
targetString: Tïŋtïŋ käk (protin) guop tit ic käm alɛ̈u bï luɔ̈i alɔŋ tïŋtïŋ tuanyku cɛth kɔc la gup tuany.

sourceString: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.
targetString: Athɛ̈m käk guop tit ic (protin) aye nyuɔth ye kɔc käde kek la gup tuany, ku ala ic kɔc kor kïit tuany ke gup ku bïk rɔ̈t nyuɔth wula kɔc ce ke kïit tïŋ ke gup.

sourceString: An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
targetString: Thuou tɔ̈u tuany ic ku käk kɔc tit gup alɛ̈u bï ke tïŋ alɔŋ athɛ̈m cï looi.

sourceString: Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
targetString: Ku rin kor athɛ̈m cï looi, cïmen pɛi diäk ruon 2020 acïn bɛ̈ɛ̈i naŋ kä puɔth cï gät piny të rɛ̈ɛ̈r köm thïn kɔc gup.

sourceString: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
targetString: Ku na ye pɛi diäk aköl nïn 23, ac̈in pan cï 3% akut kɔc ic them, ku anaŋ käjuec tëcït të cï athɛ̈m luɔi thïn bɛ̈ɛ̈i iic ebën.

sourceString: This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
targetString: Ku juëc cï käŋ iic kiith kën aye käŋ rɔ̈t kuöc cal alɔŋ thuou cï rot looi, ku aacï kek kuöc thɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ iic bɛ̈ɛ̈i kök iic.

sourceString: Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.
targetString: Të lui gäät dhaman ye käk lui guop ic cak ye cɔl (rRt-PCR) athɛ̈m alɛ̈u bï looi käk athɛ̈m cï kek yɔ̈k dhɔ̈ɔ̈l juëc iic, ku ala wɛ̈c nasopharyngeal wula luɛth.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.
targetString: Käk cï ke yɔ̈k atɔ̈u thääu thiinyɔt ic le nïn 2.

sourceString: The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.
targetString: Athɛ̈m Athɛ̈m RT-PCR cï kek käk rɔ̈l e lui wudhbuɔ tueŋ jɔ̈k tuany.

sourceString: Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.
targetString: Ku e tën köm e määr rɔ̈l ic ku le rot juak yɔkyɔk iic.

sourceString: For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.
targetString: Kɔc cï ke them wudhbɔ ic, käk yeke athɛ̈m looi alɛ̈u bï kek nyai ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc ke wɛ̈i thïn aluör ku ye kɔc ɣɔl (luɛth) alɛ̈u bï luɔ̈i.

sourceString: One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).
targetString: Athɛ̈m töŋ kam athɛ̈mthɛ̈m PCR ecï cak gen Charite pan Berlin pɛi tök ruon 2020 ke lui gäät dhaman ye käk guop lui (rRT-PCR), ku acï wɛth 250,000 guir ku tek Manadhama lui käk pial guop pinynhom (WHO).

sourceString: The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.
targetString: Pan United Kingdom acï athɛ̈m looi pɛi tök aköl nïn 23 ruon 2020. Kompany Korea lɔŋ ciɛ̈n cɔl Kogenebiotech acï të ye tuany caath thïn panakïm, keye PCR tɔ̈ cök në SARS-CoV-2 ic tïŋ cɔl (PowerChek coronavirus) aköl nïn 28 pɛi tök 2020.

sourceString: It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.
targetString: Kuat käk guop E rɔm beta coronavirus, ku käk guop RdRp keye käk SARS-CoV-2. Akut BGI e yen Kompany töŋ tueŋ cï kaŋ puöl akut käk pial guop pan China ku bï wɛnh PCR yeke SARS-CoV-2 them luɔ̈i. Pan Amerika, akut muk tuɛnytuɛny nhïïm(AKM) atek wɛth yeke 2019-jöt de coronavirus (2019-nCoV) ë tem në thää adil de TA-PCR them tek tën kɔc lui ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n yeke kɔc them gup thïn alɔŋ International Reagent Resource.

sourceString: One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.
targetString: Tök kam athɛ̈m cï kek looi thɛɛr akïc käŋ ŋiɛc nyuɔth rin le yen kë jɔ̈ɔ̈r kimikol ic, ku rin karthal ye kɔc them yeth alɔŋ CDC gen Atlanta; ku kën acï thɛ̈m cɔl akor ka kïc 100 döt akältök cï kek looi pɛi rɔu ic ruon 2020.

sourceString: Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.
targetString: Athɛ̈m cï looi käŋ kärɔu aakïc ke yɔ̈k ke lui ɣet cï pɛi nïn 28 Akɔ̈nythii 2020, ku e yen aköle yen acï ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc them gup thïn jäl puöl bïk athɛ̈m jäl jɔk cök.

sourceString: The test was approved by the Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization.US commercial labs began testing in early March 2020.
targetString: Athɛ̈m acï jal gam akut mïth ku wal (food and drug administration) lui käk rɔ̈t lac looi iic. Ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ke US yenë kɔc them thïn wɛ̈u aacï jɔk thɛ̈mthɛ̈m jɔ̈k cök pɛi diäk ruon 2020.

sourceString: As of 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced nationwide availability of COVID-19 testing based on RT-PCR.
targetString: Ku na ye aköl nïn 5 pɛi diäk ruon 2020 go akut ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc them gup thïn cɔl (LabCorp) cal lɔn ye kɔc them gup baai nhom ebën tuany COVID-19 wɛnh RT-PCR.

sourceString: Quest Diagnostics similarly made nationwide COVID-19 testing available as of 9 March 2020.
targetString: Ku käke athɛ̈m thööŋ cï loi bai ëbɛ̈n COVID-19 bɛn bɛi ke Kol e nïn 9, 2020.

sourceString: No quantity limitations were announced; specimen collection and processing must be performed according to CDC requirements.
targetString: Acïn käjuëc cï kek cal; të ye käk athɛ̈m kuöt iic thïn ku të ye kek luɔi thïn aa dhil kek luɔ̈i tëcït të wïc CDC yen.

sourceString: In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.
targetString: Pan Russia, athɛ̈m COVID-19 ecï ku bï nhial akut yäp tuɛnytuɛny käm ye cɔl State Research Center of virology ku Biotechnology VECTOR.

sourceString: On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Aköl nïn 11 pɛi rɔu ruon 2020 athɛ̈m ecï akut cɛɛth tuɛnytuɛny alɔŋ pial guop göt. Aköl nïn 12 pɛi diäk ruon 2020, panakïm Mayo ecï luel lɔn cï yen të ye COVID-19 thɛm thïn cak. Aköl nïn 13 pɛi diäk ruon 2020, Roche Diagnostic ecï FDA gam bï ya looi thääu ke 3.5 tɔ̈u nhial, ku e wɛnh tök yen ye puöl ku bï athɛ̈m 4,128 looi thääu 24 iic (akältök).

sourceString: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.
targetString: Aköl nïn 19 pɛi diäk ruon 2020, go FDA këye cɔl EUA (Emergency use authorization) gam to akut Abbott lui ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc them gup thïn ku bï athɛ̈m looi alɔŋ Abbott m2000; FDA acï kë töŋ cït kën gam tën Hologic, LabCorp, ku Thermo Fisher Scientific.

sourceString: On 21 March 2020, Cepheid similarly received EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.
targetString: Ku na ye aköl nïn 21 pɛi diäk ruon 2020, go Cepheid EUA nyai tën FDA athɛ̈m tëcït tën yuul 45 nyai.

sourceString: The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.
targetString: FDA acï athɛ̈m ye looi wɛnh isothermal nucleic acid gam tën athɛ̈m ye looi PCR.

sourceString: Since this does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles this method can deliver positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.
targetString: Rin cïn ye awer ic aliir ye wïc ka dhël kën alɛ̈u bï käk la iic tuany nyuɔth yuul kä dhïc iic ku käk cïn tuany yuul 13 iic.

sourceString: There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.
targetString: Ala wɛɛth 18,000 pan Amerika ku aye Abbot wïc bï lac alui bï athɛ̈m 50,000 ya looi akältök. Athɛ̈m lui käk guop ye cɔl monoclonal rɔ̈t mat kek protin nucleocapsid (N protin) e tuany coronavirus aguir gen Taiwan, ke ŋöth lɔn bï yen käŋ ye nyuɔth yuul 15 le yuul 20 cïmen athɛ̈m juäi.

sourceString: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."
targetString: Acï athɔ̈r pɛi diäk ruon 2020 thiök cök lɔn ka wɛɛth ye kɔc caath pɛɛm (puöth) ace tuany lac nyuɔth të puɔc yen jɔk, ku käk ye Komputer tïŋ (CT) aalɛ̈u bï rɛ̈ɛ̈r thïn të kïc kïit guɔ tuöl.

sourceString: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
targetString: Käk tɔ̈u CT ic aala iic magɔrɔ̈k cï riɛ̈u piny, kek akeu, cï giit thok ke cï thɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ, ku buɔth tɛ̈ktɛ̈k cök.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
targetString: Acï thiɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ nhom, kek aguiɛr kɔc pïïc nhïim ku cɛ̈kcɛ̈k ke tuany cil.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Athɛ̈m loi ke thɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ PCR kek CT gen Wuhan tën bï tuany thïn acï luel lɔn CT apath tën PCR, cɔk alɔn loi yen thok, ku kek  thuraa juëc ke cï ke kɔ̈th jɔ̈t kek pneumonia ku dhɔ̈ɔ̈l tuany kök.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.
targetString: Në pɛi de diäk 2020, acï America luel wu ke ye cɔl- "CT acḯ piɛth benë tuany ya them tueŋ bï ke COVID-19 tïŋ". Në pɛi de diäk 2020, go CDC/PCR kuɔny cök bï tiɛm ya caath ic tueŋ.

sourceString: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
targetString: Abaŋ kë ye guop looi bï yen tuany dhuk nhom e wɛ̈t bï dhiɛ̈th IgM ku IgG käk guop tiɛt ic wei.

sourceString: These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).
targetString: Käk aalɛ̈u bï kek luɔ̈i bï ke tuany tïŋ guop raan ic jɔk cök nïn kä 7 wula le tueŋ të cï kïït tuany tuöl, ku bï kek kë lui guop ic tïŋ ku cɛɛth kɔc guop ic. Cɛɛth guop alɛ̈u bï looi ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc them gup thïn cɔl (CLT) wula të ye kɔc muk ku them kɔc thïn cɔl (PoCT).

sourceString: The high-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be able to perform these assays but their availability will depend on the rate of production for each system.
targetString: Wɛɛth juëc ye kɔc them gup bɛ̈ɛ̈i akïïm iic aalɛ̈u bïk cɛɛth kën looi ku täu den abï ya të ye wɛnh tök lui thïn.

sourceString: For CLT a single specimen of peripheral blood is commonly used, although serial specimens can be used to follow the immune response.
targetString: Tën CLT aye riɛm lac luɔ̈i thïn, cɔk alɔn lɛ̈u bï kën athɛ̈m luɔ̈i ku bï të ye guop lui thïn buɔth ic.

sourceString: For PoCT a single specimen of blood is usually obtained by skin puncture.
targetString: Tën PoCT abaŋ riɛm tök aye yɔ̈k të cï dɛ̈l ŋuet.

sourceString: Unlike PCR methods an extraction step is not needed before assay.On March 26, 2020, the FDA named 29 entities that provided notification to the agency as required and are now therefore able to distribute their antibody tests.
targetString: Tën lɔn bï PCR luɔ̈i dhël ye luɔ̈i acï wïc ke cɛɛth kïc guɔ looi. Pɛi diäk aköl nïn 26, ruon 2020, FDA acï manadhama 29 nyuɔth manadhama lɛ̈k ku athɛ̈m käk lui guop ic tek.

sourceString: As of April 7, 2020, only a single test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use authorization.In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.
targetString: Ku na ye pɛi ŋuan aköl nïn 7, ruon 2020, athɛ̈m tök yen acï FDA lui ne baŋde gɛm cë rɔt tɛm. Thök pɛi diäk ruon 2020, ɣɔ̈n ye them gup thïn cɔl Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics ku Epitope Diagnostics aacï akut ɣurupa puöl bï käken ye kek them luɔ̈i, ku kek aa käk lui guop ic cɔl IgG ki IgA tïŋ köm tɔ̈u riɛm ic.

sourceString: The testing capacity is several hundred samples within hours and therefore much faster than the conventional PCR assay of viral RNA.
targetString: Alɔŋ athɛ̈m e buɔt le tueŋ aa kek ye looi thääu thiinyɔt ku e lac lui tën athɛ̈m PCR kën RNA (abɛ̈k guop).

sourceString: The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.
targetString: Käk lui guop ic aaye ke tïŋ të cï nïn 14 ic të cï raan luaŋ. Jɔ̈k cök pɛi ŋuan, UK acï wɛɛth ye kɔc them gup ke cïk ɣɔc yɔ̈k ke cï lui apath.

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
targetString: Anaŋ aguiɛr cï Hong Kong looi bï kɔc cï tuany ya rɛ̈ɛ̈r baai, "abaŋ lui tuɛnytuɛny kɔc lac jɔ̈ɔ̈r abï këye kɔc them gup yiɛ̈k raan tuany", ku ŋut kä ic, ku tooc kä ciɛ̈n ku bï yɔ̈k kä käk cï yɔ̈k athɛm ic läthɛɛr. Acï athɔ̈r British NHS luel lɔn them kek yen ku bïk kɔc ye kɔc puöth diu them baai, ku e kɔc kony bï raan cï tuany kɔc kök cï ben luaŋ të bï kek panakïm wula bïk thurumbil ke kɔc ɣääc ben kuöth ic bï köm nök të cï yen luɔ̈i. Të looi athɛ̈m COVID-19 tën kɔc diu kɔc puöth, kɔc lui alɔŋ pial guop aa käk ye them nyai ke tit ke gup apath.

sourceString: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
targetString: Ku cäth yene cath thin në bɛɛi yïc aci  kɔc ke South korea bɛn kuɔny areetic bi ke tuany bɛn them. Në Germany, Akutnhomë käke pial e ye luel ɣɔn ye Kol nïn 2, lɔn lëu ben naŋ athëm ke 12,000 në köl tökic ku 10.700 e cï them në ithbuɔ̈ cë lɔ.

sourceString: Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
targetString: Ku kä  yeneke bɛn riɛr në ajuɛɛr ɣɔn ci akutdhom de pialde guɔ̈p looi.

sourceString: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
targetString: Ku ka ci bany mac pande Robert koch, bɛn luel ye Germany ëë   kɔc ke 160,000 bɛn ya them gup në wik tok.

sourceString: As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ye Kol nïn 19: ke kä juëc ke themde tuany,  aci ke bɛn tak në rɔkic kedhie.

sourceString: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
targetString: Ku na ɣɔnke Kol e nïn 26, 2020,  go kɔc tuany cië bɛn në nyic  thok në ke yene nyic, në ye kɔc tuany ke pëi në juɛc de kɔc.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
targetString: Ku kɔc juëc areetic aci kek bɛn ya yöök keke tuany në wiik de 12/2020 ka adɛt de 483,295 acï bɛ̈n them agut cë ithbuɔ̈ de 12/2020 ku 33,491(6.9%) acï them ku yök ke nɔŋ SARS-CoV-2.  Në Israel, duyɔ̈ɔ̈p ke panakïm de Technion ku Rambam aake cë dhöl ë thëmë ŋuëkthii tënɔŋ ayanïïn ka 64 ëke reke cök, në mɛ̈ɛ̈tëic de ŋuëkthii ku berë ke thëm pe lɔn ŋuëk cï määtiic yök ëke nɔŋ tuany. Në Wuhan go ɣön ë këcïp  tɔ̈ kë ye 200-sq-mïtïr loi bïnë kä tem röt ya yök ëcï cäk kë ye "Huo-Yan" (Chinese:期, wälë "nyin ë mac" në Dïŋïlïth) e liep thok ɣɔn e Nyith nïn 5, 2020 në BGI, wɛ̈n lëu bï ŋuëk ka 10,000 ku kɔ̈k loi akaltökic.

sourceString: With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.
targetString: Në ajuiɛ̈r de BGI cï yök në Wang Jian në nïn ke 5, tuany acï rɔt nyuɔth në Hubei në gudhur de 47% ler tueŋ ku kë ye wɛ̈ŋde raan nyai ediët ce kɔ̈u mät na rou naŋë thëm kënë kën tɔ̈u në jïtic.

sourceString: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
targetString: Ku ka ye pande Wuhan keek lui keka ci keek bɛn ya kuany cök në kɔc ke Hou-Yan në bɛ̈ɛ̈i ke 12 ic.

sourceString: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays .  These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke pɛɛi ye nïn 4 Kol 2020, go rään 50,000 ya them në kool tok. Ke ye cɔl Origami Assays acï loi bï raan 1122 de COVID19 ya them në käŋ ke 93. Kenë abï ya loi në thëm kɔ̈k kor ke cin robot ber kɔɔr.

sourceString: By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.
targetString: Ku na ŋoot ke ye pɛɛi de diäk, go EU ku UK and US aci ka ke them ben bɛi ku cɔ ke tuany ye them tenɔŋ raan ebën.

sourceString: This has led some authors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release RNA genomes for further testing.On 31 March it was announced United Arab Emirates was now testing more of its population for Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on track to scale up the level of testing to reach the bulk of the population.
targetString: Ku yekene aci në kɔc kɔk ke pan akim bɛn riɔc ku ye ke nyuɔth nan nɔŋ ee tuany. Acïkë luel wu bï ya tuɔ̈c në digikat ke 5 agut bï tuɔ̈i lɔ në 98°C (208°F) acan bï ke ye cɔl RNA yök. Në pɛi nïn 31 Akoldït, acï caal ke United Arab Emirates cï käk juëc them.

sourceString: This was through a combination of drive-through capability, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).
targetString: Ku ka ye amat nom de  rɔt loi në biäk de china kenë kɔc kɔk agokë käŋ ya yök tenɔŋ group 42 ku BGI.

sourceString: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
targetString: Ku ɣöt acie bɛn looi në nin ke 14. Ekenë abï adɛt bianabuur de RT-̈PCR loi në köl. Ku yenëke ke tueŋ cï loi në ̈China.

sourceString: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
targetString: Na ɣɔn ke ka ke them wɔi acieke bɛn yook në China, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan ku United States.

sourceString: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
targetString: Ku piny nom acie ka ke Germany bɛn cɔ thiɛk yicku loom keke ke ye kek riinnic.

sourceString: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
targetString: Ku pan cɔl Germany, acie piny nom bɛn cɔl ke pɛɛi ye nïn 17 Akɔ̈nydït 2020, kë cï loi bë United States acï tɔ̈u agut cï pɛi nïn 28 Akɔ̈nydït. Kenë acï thëm bën gɔɔu p në United States ku jal ya China.

sourceString: In contrast, experts say South Korea's broad availability of testing helped reduce the spread of the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Ku ne luɔi yic ke ka cie bɛn luel lek kɔc ke South korea ye them alääu.

sourceString: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, was built up over several years by the South Korean government.
targetString: Ku ka yeneke them ku ka ke kacip ake ke cie ka kakuma.

sourceString: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for ramping up the testing programmes as the best way to slow the advance of COVID-19 pandemic.High demand for testing due to wide spread of the virus caused backlogs of hundreds of thousands of tests at private U.S. labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents became strained.
