targetString: Acï xen ca tiak piɛth de Wikipedia. Ë wël aye tɔ̈u ku ka yakë yök në raan ëbɛ̈n, ku ye kë piɛth adɛ̈ ku bï wɛ̈l ya yɔ̈k webthaid kɔ̈u ku bï raan ebën ya tïŋ.

sourceString: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
targetString: Lui duɔn acï ekënë ca loi rɔt, kɔc cï tɔ̈u në Wikipedia wenë kɔc cï wëu tau piny

sourceString: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
targetString: Pinynhom ebën kɔɔr wël ye Wikipedia ke gam

sourceString: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
targetString: Kënë e yene kam lëu cenë kë yeku looi yetök, ku të yeku luɔ̈i yen, abë naŋ wɛ̈t yic bë pinynhom kony.

sourceString: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
targetString: Acan riɛlic de ye luɔ̈i dɛnë ku luɔi duɔn abï kenë ca gɔl lui në wïïk bï bën

sourceString: Adjustments to our work and schedules
targetString: Cök piny de luɔi da

sourceString: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
targetString: Cï mɛn ë raan ye cɔl Robyn ye luel, wɔ cï mat wan në të bukku luɔi ekënë në pɛɛi bï bɛ̈n

sourceString: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we're facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
targetString: Në ye jam kën ic, ka cuk tak ye dhël nɛn yen path ku bï ke manadhama cɔl ala tueŋ ke lui dhaman kën ic.

sourceString: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
targetString: Në kë dït arët, ke wɔ̈ kɔɔr bukku dhuruup nyaai ku bukku kɔc kuɔny në nïn juëc

sourceString: If you need to dial back, that's okay.
targetString: Na kɔɔr ba cɔɔl cën, ke ka cï raac

sourceString: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
targetString: Tënɔŋ bäny ku kɔc cïke luɔ̈i

sourceString: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
targetString: Thɛɛr ke luɔi abï ya thɛɛr ke 4 wenë thɛɛr ke 20 në wïïkic

sourceString: We're not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
targetString: Wɔ cï bï jai të kɔɔr yïn ba lui në thɛɛr juëc

sourceString: However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
targetString: Ë kënë acï nyic yeŋö bï rɔt looi në nïn bï ben. Ku mɛn bï kɔc nyïn ya tïït në rɔt ago kɔc rɔt ya xɔi ka thi ke pïïr

sourceString: We are not tracking your time.
targetString: Ace thɛɛr du yenë kɔɔr ku

sourceString: If you are sick, do not work.
targetString: Na ca tuany ke yï du lui

sourceString: This should go without saying, but we're saying it.
targetString: Alɔ ke kënë luel ku ka cukku luel

sourceString: No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.
targetString: Acï kɔɔr ba lui ke yï tuany wälë PTO wïc. Na ca tuany ke yï jam wenë bäny du ago yï ca lui në köl dɛ̈t

sourceString: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
targetString: Na cï yïn yök ke yï tuany në COVID-19 ke lɛkë Bryan tɔu T&C Ops ago T&C lëu bï kony bë tuany du nyic në kɔc tɔ̈ tueŋ në yïnhom ago kë ye kony)

sourceString: Hourly folks will be fully paid.
targetString: Kɔc abï ya dɔ̈m në thɛɛr

sourceString: We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
targetString: Acuk ku luel wu kɔc abï ya dɔ̈m në thɛɛr cïke lui. Dïktor ku jal ya kɔc lui kedhia

sourceString: Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
targetString: Raan ebën abï ya dɔ̈m në thɛɛr ken cen ke lui

sourceString: This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
targetString: Agut cï raan cï tuany ku cï lui bï ya miɔc

sourceString: If you want to work, we support you.
targetString: Na kɔɔr ba lui, ke yïn bukku kony

sourceString: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
targetString: Kɔc kɔ̈k aye lui ke ye dhɔl nyɛɛi ke dhurup

sourceString: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
targetString: Ke yukku loi ë ya ke piɛth në thɛɛr cït emënë

sourceString: Again, this is about your self-care.
targetString: Ëkë de gël de guɔp du

sourceString: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba ya lɛ̈k bäny du të cïn tuany ago bany nyic

sourceString: Some work is considered essential.
targetString: Lui dɛ̈t aye yök ke rilic

sourceString: There are some things that we must keep doing.
targetString: Anɔŋ ka bukku dhil ya loi

sourceString: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
targetString: Akutnhom de SRE, HR ops, ku Trust & Safety, ku akut de kut wɛ̈u (ku kɔc kɔ̈k) aye lui luɔi rilic arëëtic.

sourceString: We'll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what's essential for our mission.
targetString: Aabuk jɔk cök kek kɔc lui ku buk käk ke wïc caath ku them ku bï ya kë wïcku yen yeku kuɔny cök.

sourceString: There's plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
targetString: Wɔ nɔŋ kä juëc bike loi. Wɔ bï ka rilic arët lɔ̈m ku loi ku ke tueŋ

sourceString: Slowing now won't hurt later.
targetString: Lɔ da amääth ëmɛnë acïn kë riɔk në nïïn bï ben

sourceString: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
targetString: Aken ku maat ke wɔ̈ bï ya lui në thɛɛr juëc të lë tuany jal

sourceString: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
targetString: Yïn acï bï yɔ̈k ba ya lui ne thääu juëc ku ba käk wïc kek lac gam.

sourceString: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
targetString: Ayeku gam lɔn cï piny rot waar, ku ok aabï lui buk kën yam ku dhaman wïcku tau tëcït tën wïc yen.

sourceString: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
targetString: Yeŋö cï rɔt luɔɔi në APP ne (biäk de ajuɛr de ruɔ̈n)?

sourceString: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï loiloi bɛr cɔ̈k piny agut cï thɛɛr ke luɔi. Ajuiɛɛr de 2020-2021 akɔɔr bï looi.

sourceString: Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.
targetString: Ajuiɛɛr de 2019-2020 akɔɔr bï nyɔ̈k loi ago rööŋ ke wëu tɔ̈u në kɔc cin. Raan lui ebën a bïnë thɛɛr kɛn ke luɔi ca dhuɔ̈k piny ago wëu rööŋ kenë thɛɛr.

sourceString: This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
targetString: Ajuiɛɛr kënë acï luɔ̈i ca kor ku kë cï manathamat kuut ke bï looi në ruɔ̈n acï rɔt bï bɛr looi.

sourceString: We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
targetString: Wɔ bï ya ajuiɛɛr ë gɔl në wïïk ke rou bï bën. Ku wek bukku kë yɔ̈k ke cin ë ya ajuiɛɛr ë gɔl.

sourceString: Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
targetString: Wɔ cï kɔc ke APP ë ke looi ajuɛɛrë leec arëëtic.

sourceString: Office status, exposure, and cleaning
targetString: Täu de maktap, ku luel bïe de ku bï ya waakic.

sourceString: Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
targetString: Në wïïk wan cï tëk ke raan tök de SF acï yök ke tuany ne COVID-19 .

sourceString: However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
targetString: Në ye ka juëc ke gël ke yic ke wɔ̈ ye xan ëbɛ̈n wec në asubun.

sourceString: They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
targetString: Kek aakë cï gam panakïm bï ke köm ya nɔ̈k luɔ̈i kuat ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n ye kɔc got ic, cïmen käk ye kɔc wuny piiny.

sourceString: The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
targetString: Kɔc ye ɣöt juɔ̈r yic acï kiɛɛr ken ke gël de tuany tau ago kɔc cï juir ce tuaany.

sourceString: We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
targetString: Ë kë piɛɛth arët acan bukku maktɛp lɔ yök miäk kë cï juiir apiɛth të le wuɔk dhuk.

sourceString: Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
targetString: Maktapdan de DC atɔ̈ WuɔkLui, mɛn cï kiɛɛr ken ke gël de tuany cɔl COVID-19 rɔm kenë wɔɔk ku kɔc ke DC ëya .

sourceString: As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
targetString: Në wïïk wan ke maktap de DC  acï ben lar në bɛ̈ɛ̈i mec kenë geeu ku ka loi ku kenë San Francisco.

sourceString: As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
targetString: Wɔ kɔr bukku maktaap de NYC dɛ̈t loi Pan ye cɔl Brooklyn.

sourceString: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
targetString: Ekënë abï rɔt looi ku ka bï gääu amääth.

sourceString: Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
targetString: Kɔc kɔ̈k aken kaan lui në bɛ̈ɛ̈i mec kenë geeu yenë ka awel bïkë lui ë tënë.

sourceString: Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
targetString: Määth juëc kuɔ tɔ̈u në gondo yic aŋic kë ke ye wɛ̈r de rɔt, ku ka kɔɔr kë bïkë yï jäm nhom.

sourceString: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï amɛɛt ca lik ku cï ke col ë ke loi.

sourceString: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï amɛɛt ya loi në thɛɛr lik arëëtic ku pɔɔl kɔc.

sourceString: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï kë bï luel a matic ya lɛk kɔc ke thaar da amat ŋot.

sourceString: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï amɛɛt ya loi në video yin ago kɔc röt ce ɣok.

sourceString: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
targetString: Akɔɔr bï naŋ raan bï amat ya juiir ku raan bï kɔc ya nyooth cin  bï kɔc jam,ku raan bï käŋ ya gɔɔr(wenë bï ya gɔ̈ɔ̈r kenë raan dɛ̈t).

sourceString: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba lɛ̈k kɔc ka ajuiɛɛr bïkë yï muɔɔc në käk ke pïŋ.

sourceString: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba kë kɔr ba cam cɔl.

sourceString: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
targetString: Akɔɔr bï jam wenë kɔc kë në cabaka nyin ku ke yï lɛ̈k luɔi.

sourceString: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
targetString: Akutnhom de HR ë kɔc luɔ̈ɔ̈i akɔɔr bï të yen luɔi tɛ̈k thïn thitic.

sourceString: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
targetString: Në wïïk wan cï tëk ke manadhamat acï xan ke guëër thök thok agut cï thaar benë WHO mɛn yenë  Akutnhom de gël de tuany jam bïkë liep.

sourceString: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
targetString: Acukku ca ŋic kë mɛn cï tḧïic dan ye wɔ ye luel wu bï löŋ nyaai mɛn cï yic kɔ̈ɔ̈c bï loi acan bï kë kɔɔr rɔt yök.

sourceString: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
targetString: Në ye wïïk bï ben, ke wɔ̈ bï cääth bukku tïŋ mɛn käŋ röt tau në ɣan ken.

sourceString: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
targetString: A kënë acï pinynhom ebën riɔk piɔ̈u ku ka cin të luië yen. Akɔɔr bï kɔc nyïn tïït në bɛ̈ɛ̈i ken.

sourceString: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
targetString: Kɔ̈k cï mɛn de CRT akɔɔr bïke cabaka cï Meta-Wiki loi benë wëël kë ya go rɔm thïn.

sourceString: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
targetString: Abï raan ya ca nɔŋ nyic në kake COVID-19.

sourceString: We'll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
targetString: Wɔ bï ajuiɛɛr cï loi ya tuɔ̈c në yom kamith, 14:00 UTC/0 7:00 PT në kööl amat.

sourceString: We'll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
targetString: Wɔ bï thaar kenë loi keye kë bï wɔ wëël ya rɔm kenë kɔc.

sourceString: We're in this together and here to help however we can.
targetString: Wɔ bï röt kony arëëtic në biäk de ye tuanyë.

sourceString: In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
targetString: Në ye thäär ë ke ka kɔɔr ba kë wëël ya yök në cabaka nyin keke ye kë ke COVID-19.

sourceString: The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
targetString: Ke ye cɔl CRT abï week ya lɛ̈k ke loi rɔt.

sourceString: We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
targetString: Wɔ tɔ̈u ke wɔ̈ loi ke bï në ya jam kenë kɔc tɔu pan nɔŋic tuany.

sourceString: If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don't hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
targetString: Na nɔŋ kë kɔɔr ba nyic në ye kenë yic ke yin bï wɔ ya yök në cabaka nyin ku ka bukku guiir në yïnhom apiɛt tenɔŋ CRT.

sourceString: We're here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
targetString: Luɔi da ë tënë ë bukku week ya lɛ̈k ke loi rɔt në biäk de ye tuanyë.

sourceString: If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
targetString: Na nɔŋ kë kɔɔr ba nyic ke yïn tuɔcë thualdu tëne Bryant Judan de HR wenë tuɔcë të yen pinynhom käŋ luel thïn

sourceString: None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
targetString: Acï kɔɔr bï ekënë ya tïŋ cït ke wɔ cï loi da piɔl.

sourceString: Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
targetString: Ku këya, aa kek cuk ke tïŋ dhaman kën, luɔida ku mukthuliada e wɛ̈t buk dhɔ̈ɔ̈l kɔ̈k yam ce dhɔ̈ɔ̈l thɛɛr.

sourceString: These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
targetString: Kakë ke ka ye kuɛɛr bï yen ya nyuɔɔth ke wɔ̈ lui ë tök, ku kony ku akut kuɔny wïc kä ku pinynhom kek loiloi bï kek rɛ̈ɛ̈r ke kɔ̈th.

sourceString: Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
targetString: Ajuiɛɛrë cï loi ke ye këde ye ruɔnë abï bɛr loi në thɛɛr dɛ̈t të cïnë tuany jäl

sourceString: For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
targetString: Ëmɛn ë, ëke thaar lë bïnë kɔc rɔth kony ku bïkë kɔc lui ë tök ku bï nak lon loi në wiik wenë pen bï bɛ̈n.

sourceString: We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
targetString: Akɔɔr ku bï raan ebën nyin tïït në pïïr de ku jal ya bɛ̈ɛ̈i kuɔn kedhia

sourceString: Now, please -- wash your hands and don't touch your face!
targetString: Yen, akɔɔr ba raan yecin ya waak në nyindhie ku du në yin nyin jak.

sourceString: Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).
targetString: Loi kënë a loi kɔ̈k juëc arëëtic. Ye CRT Rïŋken ëë (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregore V, Jaime V, Joe L, Lynette L, Ryan m, ku Tony S) ku bäny kɔk kë yi (Grant l, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, ku Toby N).

sourceString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
targetString: Wël ye dek në 2(ACE2) emɛ̈në ë rɔt lɔ täu në piɔ̈u kɔ̈u ku guyɔɔk kɔth ku në ciïn kɔth ëya.

sourceString: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
targetString: ACE2 e kä loi de angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) thiäk kekë ye bë angiotensin-II ya dhuɔ̈k piny ku juɛk Ang(1-7) bë loi kë ye wäl lëu bï lui në yïlanyde tuënytuɛny ë  puöu. ACE2 e rɔt loi kë ye yen e dhöl ye coronavirus kɔ̈k luɛ̈ŋ në rälic.

sourceString: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
targetString: Wël rɔk ke raan aye cɔl hACE2.

sourceString: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
targetString: Angiotensin ë enzyme 2 wel dhiŋ nɔŋic metalloenzyme cï täu në dɛ̈l kɔ̈u ku räl kɔ̈k.

sourceString: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
targetString: ACE2 protin anɔŋic N-terminal peptidase de akuutë M2 ku C-terminal collectrin e akuutë rälke amino acid caath.

sourceString: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
targetString: ACE2 e ya töŋ ë nuɔu I de räpräp yök ke tɔ̈u në protin, ku kë lui guöp ic acï nyuɔth yɔ̈ɔ̈kyɔ̈ɔ̈k nhïïm ku jɔla räl thii ke guöp kɔ̈k.

sourceString: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
targetString: Käk rɔ̈t looi ACE2 aɣer e rot looi alɔŋ dɛ̈l käk guöp ye cɔl sheddase, ku protin lui guöp ic e rot päl riɛm ic ku aye bɛ̈n bei lɛc iic.

sourceString: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
targetString: ACE2 kënë aye yök në guɔp de raanic: ACE2 aye yök në biäk de gɔiyɔ̈ɔ̈k ye cɔl type II, ku jal ya cïïn kor kɔ̈th, rɛ̈ɛ̈l dït ku rɛ̈ɛ̈l kor ku jal ya rɛ̈ɛ̈l wën yeke yök në guɔpic.

sourceString: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
targetString: ACE2 mRNA aye yök ëya në biäk de nyith de raanic.

sourceString: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
targetString: Ë kënë ACE2 anɔŋ nhom luɔi dït në guɔp de raanictë nɔŋ ACE.

sourceString: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.
targetString: ACE e angiotensin I hormone ɣaric bë ya këde angiotensin II ë nhiɛcë räl.

sourceString: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
targetString: ACE2 eë kë ye cɔl aa carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine tenɔŋ angiotensin ll (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) ku hydrolyses ayevwen keye angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

sourceString: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
targetString: ACE2 ë ka juëc loi në guɔp de raanic cï mɛn [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin,dynorphin A ku Ghrelin.

sourceString: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
targetString: ACE2 ëya anɔŋ ke ye caath në guɔp de raanic. Ë käk ë pïïr de guɔ̈p caath SLC6A19.

sourceString: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
targetString: Ë kënë yenëke ye ACE2 tuanyë rɔt liɛny në raan guɔp ci mɛn de käm ye HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV(käm wën në SARS bɛn);ku SARS-CoV-2 wën në COVID-19 bɛn.

sourceString: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
targetString: Kë dït de, ken de rɔt ekë ye  cɔl S1 de SARS-CoV ku SARS-  CoV2 tenɔŋ ACE2 në ɣan ke guɔp ee cäth de kɔ̈m bɛɛi në guɔpic.

sourceString: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
targetString: Lɔ thïn de eya akɔɔr käk ke yïïk nhial de guɔp cï mɛn de S në TMPRSS2, kɔ̈ɔ̈c de aŋot ke kɔɔr riic. Ekenë acï kɔ̈k ca jam wu dhuk de nyin piny de ACE2 në guɔpic alë bï tuany gël.

sourceString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
targetString: Acï akutnhïm juëc kɔc cë piöc ku jɔla akuutë tïtë nyin ya luel bï kë ye ACE dɔm ku luɔi de piathde ARB muɔ̈k thïn.

sourceString: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
targetString: Acï akutnhom dɛ̈t de dïktor luel  në pɛɛi nïn 11 2012,wu ka ce kɔc juëc ye ACE lui bike 34% ce miin piɔth.

sourceString: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
targetString: Kɔc kɔ̈k wën lë bï tuany cït mɛn de yitiabat ë kɔc ruɔk piɔu e cï dhuɔ̈k piny tënë ayanïïn cï ke alacu në ACE aye ke tök në wal de kɔc nɔŋ tuany de piɔu.

sourceString: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
targetString: Na cï raan tök në ACE de tuaany de piɔu ke ka cï ber tuany aretic në tuany ë mien piɔth

sourceString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Raan cï tuany aretic aye tök në wɛl yam ACE2 (rhACE2) cï loi ku jal ya aliir në tau në raan wum ago wëëi apiɛth. Ekenë ë raan kony ago cë thou.

sourceString: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
targetString: Wɛl ye cɔl rhACE2 ë tɔu në raan guɔ̈p në thɛɛr ke 10 ku ke luɔi gɔl në raan guɔ̈p në digikat ke 30 në tök wën ë thɛɛr ke 24 jɔt ku bï jal lui.

sourceString: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Acï luel ekë gaak wu rhACE2 alë bï ya wal piɛth tenɔŋ kɔc tiam ke ye cɔl renin-angiotensin (RAS) wenë tuɛnytuɛny ekë ye cɔl angiotensin ll ca juak rɔt. Wël ye cɔl rhACE2 e rɔt dhit të tökë raan ce wëi apiɛth në guyɔ̈ɔ̈k ic.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
targetString: Anɔŋ kɔc cï telepun loi bï kɔc kuɔny në gël de ya tuanyë COVID-19. Telepun cï loi kenë, e koth tecin rɔt cuɔt tenɔŋ raan tuany de 2019-20 korona.

sourceString: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
targetString: Anɔŋ ka juëc cïke loi cï mɛn de telepun wën tɔu ke ye raan tuany nyuɔth. Acë akumat juëc ke gam ke kaakë

sourceString: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
targetString: Dhɔ̈l juëc ke gël de ye tuanyë acë yök cï mɛn de telepun bï raan tuany ya nyuɔth.

sourceString: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
targetString: Acï kɔc kɔ̈k luel wu telepun cï loi kenë akɔɔr bï loi acan bë të tɔu ë raan ya nyuɔɔth.

sourceString: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Akɔɔrkɔc kɔ̈k bï loi aa telepun wën bï raan ya nyuɔth të dɛn rëër ɣen thïn.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
targetString: Në Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 10, 2020, acë kɔc ke cabaka luel wu bï kɔc kuɔny në loi de ye telepunë ku jɔla iOS.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: Akuma de chainïth ku Alipay acï telepun loi bï raan rɔt ya tïŋ mɛn cï rëër ke raan tuany në COVID-19 ke cï nyic.

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: Atɔ̈ kë ye loi në bɛ̈i ka 200 ke chaina. Lɔŋde Thiŋapor, yenë këde tëlëpun ye cɔl BuɔthAtök aye loi.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: Eë telepun kenë aloi në kɔc tɔ̈u në bɛi yic ke IT, lony ke ɣɔr ku ka bï yën Akuma. North Macedonia acï "Kääcëkorona" loi, ee bulututh benë raan cï tuany ya kɔɔr ku në kɔc ke panakïm.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: Telepun kenë aloi kɔc ke akuma de pan ye cɔl chaina.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: Në pɛi nïn 14 Bildït 2020, ke ci loi kenë akuɔɔr bï jal lony në kɔc ke cabaka.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: Në Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 12, akuma ë jam wu kë cï loi kenë abï kɔc juëc cuɔp në wiik be bën. Akuma de Ireland ku France abï ke cït kenë loi ëya ("KääcëKorona").

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: Australia ku New Zealand aawïc bïk löŋ ë këde tëlëpun cɔl BuɔthAtök ku Bɔ̈thëBlututh de Thiŋapor. Russia acë ŋuun bë këde tëlëpun cɔl geofencing loi tënë ayanïïn cï yök ëke tuany në COVID-19 ciɛ̈ŋ Moscow, ë juïr agokï cuökë jääl bai.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
targetString: Dïktor ye cɔl Ross Anderson e jam wu kë cï loi kenë anɔŋ kɔk cï luoi apiɛth. Kɔk alë bïke raan cï tuany nyuɔth ke tuany, ku ala ic käk cï ke yɔ̈k ke cï lui ku kuöc luɔi ku të cï app e lui ajɔtwɛ̈l ic gäm akut thiin kor yen cï gam.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
targetString: Në biak de cabaka cï yic ë luel në kë de "koronavirus", ke ye cɔl Apple acï löŋ tau të de manadhama bï lui kenë yen në kak thëëny rɔt coronavirus, acï manadhamat dhiɛkic gam.

sourceString: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
targetString: Kɔc ke cabaka abï ë lɔŋ tääu ëya.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
targetString: Kɔc kɔk aye jam wu ke cï loië abï riɔk të lë tuany jal, akutnhom kenë cï loi në biak de korona abï riɔk të lë ye tuanyë jal.

sourceString: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Akuthniim ke pial de guɔp cï mɛn de Amnety international ku manadhamat aye jam wu ke cï 100 loië acï bï loi të lë tuany jal.

sourceString: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
targetString: Manadhamat acï akuma lɔ̈ŋ ke bɛ̈t lɛk Akuma bïke kuany cök.

sourceString: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
targetString: Ajuir de tïït de nyin akɔɔr bï tääu në lɔ̈ŋic.

sourceString: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
targetString: Akutnhom de tïït de nyin abï loide cuɔt ago tuany lëu në gël.

sourceString: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
targetString: Akɔɔr bï cabaka loi ke ye kede gël dë tuany ye cɔl COVID-19.

sourceString: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
targetString: Cabaka akɔɔr benë nyin tïit apiɛth ku loi ke ye kë benë wël ke ye tuany ya luel thïn.

sourceString: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
targetString: Ajuir de tïït de nyin acï kɔɔr bï tuanyë ya cuai në ye thok.

sourceString: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
targetString: Raan bï cabaka kenë rɔm kenë raandiɛ abï dɔm ku tɛuë̈ ɣɔn de döm.

sourceString: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
targetString: Ku ka apiɛth bï menh ke baai nɔŋ yic dɛn në yekenë yic.

sourceString: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
targetString: Tuanyë kɔɔr bï raan ebën ye cin tau thïn ago rɔt gël apiɛth. Anɔŋ akuthnom kɔk cï jam në yekenë yic. Akut de Germany ye cɔl (CCC) ku (RSF) acï jam thïn eya.

sourceString: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
targetString: Google/Apple aaye kä them ku bïk kë jɔ̈ɔ̈r cɔ̈k piny të nyai kek käk kɔc buɔth cɔ̈k wɛ̈thken iic  të cï yen ben wïc.

sourceString: Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
targetString: Bɛ̈i kɔ̈k aa kuënyë cök ë të tɔ̈ raan loi në cabaka pɛth në nyin e kë ye cɔl app cï loië, nyɛi kë ye cɔl app ë cï luië däonlot jɔla lëu bïnë kuënyë cök puöl, ku ka cï dolat kɔk gam.

sourceString: In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
targetString: Cabaka cï loië acï gam pan ye cɔl yïthïrɛɛl.

sourceString: Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
targetString: Käk kɔc kony alɔŋ network lac yök kek käk bai nyuɔth  aa naŋ kë jɔ̈ɔ̈r alɔŋ rɛ̈ɛ̈rden rɔ̈t.

sourceString: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).
targetString: Acë cabaka cï loi ebën yen ye të tɔu raan thïn nyuɔth. Cabaka dɛt acï loi ke ye kede jam dit ce reek.

sourceString: In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.
targetString: Pan ye cɔl South Korea,akën ë cabaka cï loië gam ke ye yic.

sourceString: Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.
targetString: Badäl bï ya kë cɔl app cï luɔ̈i në tëlëpunic, kë cï cak e wël kuöt iic ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n juëc ic agut kä ye ajɔtwël yɔ̈k ku kärät ye wël kuöt iic, ku käkä aaye määtic ku bï ke kɔc cï luaŋ ŋic.

sourceString: In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.
targetString: Në biak de thiëpiny de wël wën ke ye tuany, ke akuma acï wël kɔk gɛr ku tɛu në ɣan ebën agut cï piom thï kedhiɛ̈, kɔ̈k acï ke piɔl ɣɔn cenë MERS lɔ bïɛ ë dola yic.

sourceString: This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.
targetString: Ë wël ke acï ke tau në cabaka yic ago kɔc juëc ke ya yök. Pan ye cɔl ̈̈̈Germany acï wël ke ca cuup kɔc juëc ken në dhɔl ke cabaka ebën.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.
targetString: Acï ke bɛr luel ke pɛɛi ye nïn 6 Bildït 2020,në biak de ye cabaka kenë a kenë bɛn nyaai.

sourceString: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Luɔi de cabaka kenë acï rɔt dac jɔk në run de 2013. Mënë ye Akɔ̈nydït nïn 7, 2020, kɔc juëc aretic akë tɔu në ye luɔi kenë yic ëke loi Blututh de Riɛl tɔ̈ Piiny (BRP). Ayekë kɔɔr bïke cabaka wenë kɔc juëc reet ë door tök.

sourceString: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.
targetString: Kë yeen, PEPP-PT ajuɛr cï juir nɔŋic dhöl kerou cï ke ruknhïïm ku kä cï tɛkpiny, ku acie löŋ tök. Löŋ cï tɛkpiny anɔŋiic Decentralized Privacy-preserving Proximity de Bɔ̈ɔ̈thë cök (DP-PPT/DP-3B), Nïmïra cë Gäu ke Cɔ̈t (NGC, fka Nïmïra ë Cɔ̈t ke Luɔi, NCL), Lööŋ Lacäp ke Thian ku Kuɛr ke Bɔ̈ɔ̈thë cök de Nïmïra de Tëlëpun (LLTKBNT) ku kɔ̈k.

sourceString: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.
targetString: Ekenë acï juir në dhɔ̈l cenë wɛ̈l ke raan dɛŋ etïŋ në raan dɛŋ.

sourceString: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: Akutnhom ye cɔl MIT media Lab e juir DhölPiɛth, e të yenë takatït ke tɔ̈uë kɔ̈u-thian na kuutë ɣän ke rɛ̈ɛ̈r ku jɔla thönthii arämkuɛr agorë lathiëi bec de COVID-19 ya buɔɔt cök.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: Acï täu në tɔ kɔ̈u tënë warɛŋɣer "Apps Cïnë Rogue: e Thian ë Raan Muk Cök në Tuanyic" ë pɛ̈lë bec në Kol ic 2020. Dɛ̈t thöŋ kek e tëdë BɔɔthPiɛth ë loi Enigma MPC, ëye manädhama loi tëknɔlojïïth ke thian ë kɔŋ MIT Media Lab kan loi.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: Anɔŋ ke cï loi yenë të tɔ̈u ë raan thïn nyuɔth ye cɔl DhölPiɛth ku ka yenë wël ke pial de guɔp rɔm kenë kɔc kɔ̈k, ke cïn kë nyuɔɔth rɔt të dɛ̈t.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: Në pɛi nïn 5 Bildït 2020,kɔc kɔk ke ̈TCN acï nyuc piny ke loi ke cabaka binë wël ke ye tuanyë ya luel thïn. Ekenë aye kɔc juëc kɔɔr bikë yök agokë wël ke ye tuanyë dac yök.

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: Në Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 9, 2020, pan ye cɔl Singa pore,acï cabaka de BɔɔthëBlututh loi benë kɔc ka akuma wël ya ciɛtic.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: Në Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 10, 2020, kɔc ke cabaka ku manadhamat acï ajuir de telepun ku iOS loi. Telepun akɔɔr bï loi ke yenë jam në wël ke ye tuanyë.

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: Kek aacï käk ye teknologia lui göt wɛ̈ɛ̈thken iic.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: Në biak de kɔc ke cabaka,ke ajuirë abï loi biɛ në dhɔl de diäk.

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: Abï akuma kuɔny acan bï wël ya luel biɛ në thäär kor.

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: Ekenë abï tau në iOS ku AndroidGoogle ku jal ya Apple acan bï thaai piny, ku ka bï nyaai në dhööl ɣɔn loië yen të lë tuany jal.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: Dhukde walë 'b në kanadeic (aye cɔl eyɛ dhukë wal në luɔndeic, dhukë nyiɛndeic, dhukë luɔi wälë wɛlë juërë piath), e dhukë wäl ë cï gam në luɔndeic tënë yïlany de yïlacɛt ë tuɛnytuɛny wääc wälë ɣäla de tuany wär kë ë cïnë ye ŋuönthïn në luɔideic

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: Yennë kɛ̈n töŋ kän ë yɔ̈ɔ̈pë käkë konyë pïr abuɔth cök ëmɛnë ago kë piɛth loi ku yïlany lajik de KOBIT-19.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: Dhölke yɔ̈ɔ̈p köki anɔŋic cäŋë lɔtueŋë wäl ë KOBIT-19 kuöjɔla toomde riɛm në guɔ̈pic. SARS-CoV-2  anɔŋ kä cït wɛl 66 nɔŋic protin, e tök yic naŋ ligan ku jɔla ɣänmat kuötic.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: Cɛthë c në ye ɣänmatkä aagɛm ajuɛrë wɛ̈t piɛthë lɔtueŋ ë lajiŋë wɛlë bairäth tënë protin de KOBIT-19.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: Në kë ye kë tueŋ apɛi tënë SARS-CoV-2 cë täuë kë rilic aaye papen -cït proteth gei de rɔtë RNA, polimereth RNA, proti  de heliketh, ku ribopothpateth de ADP.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: Hussein A A, et al acë kuen  në kä juëc wɛ̈r kuɔthïïm gäk apɛi wën lekelaathic ëke cï rok lïr keic në yomkɛn thɔ̈ŋ kekë wɛl cï ke gam nɔŋ thɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ dït ago luoi bën nhial de piathë wɛl ke SARS-CoV-2 juak ë lɔnhial tënë akërnhiaam denë kuën ë göörë cäät në  kuë  den akïmic.

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: Kolorkuin e wäl ë yïlanyë juäi wɛ̈n e loi bïnë tuɛnytuɛny kök tɔ̈ në guɔ̈pic ya alacu.

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: Ɣɔn e Kol nïn 18, go APMP caal lɔn bïnë kolorkuin ubup ku kolorkuin ë nyin pïu thiäk thookaabë tɔ̈ në walic ke ŋuan gɔ̈ric kë ye baŋde athëëmakïm ë köc atök.

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: Hakïm de New York Andrew Cuomo ecë caal lɔn bï athëëm wäläya de New York bïnë ye loi tënë kolorkuin ë ubup ku kolorkuin ë nyin pïu jöök kë Kol e nïn 24. Aköl e Akɔnydït nïn 28, go FDA wäl de kolorkuin thälpet ë nyin  pïu ku kolorkuin pothpet ë ubuppäl bec në rinke Teemë thïn Ukbma de Luɔi (TUL)

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: Yïlac aŋot ë kënë guɔ gam në kuɛrka athëëmthëëm de FDA ku aye gam bec në ukuma ë rinke TUL e kë ye nyothde yïlac tënë luɔiden ë rɔt tɛɛm tënɔŋ kɔc tuany cï tääc panakïm kua kën yöök kekë yïlac në thëmdë akïmic

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: Acï CDC lueel lɔn nɔŋ "luɔide, dëkde, wälë dhamɛnde kolorkuin ë nyin pïu de propelɛdhith wälë yïlanyde wuɔɔk ë SARS-CoV-2" aakënë guɔ cɔ̈k piny.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: Dïktoor aacë jam ka loi wäl në "cën en dɛ̈t lɔc".

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: Akuutde Turki ë yɔ̈ɔ̈p tɔ̈ Istanbul aa loi kuën thin kor në lɔŋde luɔi de kolorkuin në mɛ̈ɛ̈t mɛ̈të ke yic kekë dhiŋ, bïtamin A, bïtamin C ku bïtamin D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: Akuënkuëndït aatɔ̈ dhölic baŋde jamade Duke ku jama de Oxford.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: Thukulde wɛl ë NYU Langone aloi athëm tënë pial ku juëkëic ë gëlë luɔi de kolorkuin ë nyin pïu.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Athëëmthëëm akïm ke Caina tɔ̈ Wuhan ku Shenzhen aaye kï lueel bïk nyuɔth pabipirabir e "lui apiɛth".

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Ayanïïn 35 tɔ̈ Shenzhen cï them ku rɛ̈ɛ̈rkï guupë pɛth në nïn cɛlic ke 4, ke bërëic ë tuany ë nïn 11 të ë ayanïïn ka 45 ë kën e yöök.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Në cärë cï loi  Wuhan tënë ayanïïn ke 240 tënɔŋ tuany alirë piöuic nhuth e cï yiën pabïpirabir ku lööm nhuth në umipenobir.

sourceString: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
targetString: Dutunyë ɣön ë wɛl ke Itali e juöör ëbën täknhom lɔn tɔ̈ kë ye wäl kuɔny  në nyoth kä lik ku akërnhiaam.

sourceString: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kë Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 2, go Germany caal lɔn bï kek ɣööc ë wäl tënë Japan në wëukɛn tɔ̈ në tɔ̈uic, ku loi kï jec bï kek wɛl gam panakïm ë jamaic agorë wal lɔ loi bïnë ayanïïn ke KOBIT-19 lɔ alacu.

sourceString: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
targetString: Në të cït të ye Agöt becë nhiäkduur ë Thath Caina e luɛl thïn, Shinzo Ab acë thiëc loi tënë akuma de Trump në baŋde ɣööcë wɛl. wäl alëu bë lui amääth tënë tuany cë nyindït apɛi wɛ̈n cï bairäth ye yic mät thïn apɛi.

sourceString: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
targetString: Acë lëu bë piath kekë tiŋ liac wälë kɔc wïc bïk yöök ke meth

sourceString: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
targetString: Akuën töŋë lopinabir/ritonabir(kaletra), amɛ̈tëic de wɛlke bairäth ë lopnabir ku ritonabir, ku thiök cök ë "acën kë juɛk thïn e tïŋ".

sourceString: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
targetString: Kekë wɛlkäake loi  bïk HIV ya gɛ̈l nyin piny në dhiënh en rɔtdhiëëth bï ya matë protethic.

sourceString: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
targetString: Akuut kɔc ë yɔ̈ɔ̈p tɔ̈ jamade Colorado aathem bïk wɛl nyɔkë luɔi agokï kë kuötic yöök bï mat kekë proteth de SARS-CoV-2.  Anɔŋ jiëtë cök  tënë wunë käke pial baŋde wɛ̈lë käŋ në kanadɛnë luɔi ë cï rok ë juër ë lɔtueŋ wɛ̈nthɛɛr ëke käke HIV/AIDS.

sourceString: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
targetString: APMP acë lopinabir/ritonabir matë athëëm ë köc atök në pinynhom.

sourceString: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
targetString: Remdethibir e cak ku loi bë lɔtueŋ në käke pial ë Gilead kë yennë bairäth Ebola alacu ku wuɔ̈kë Marburg bairäth. Käke pial ë Gilead acïk bënë dhiɛl pinyë yöök lɔn ye Remdethibi nɔŋen wal nɔŋ ajɛraat  en nɛ̈kë bairäth tɔ̈ në bitroic ë lɔ kekë pilo kuötic-, ku koronabairäth.

sourceString: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
targetString: Töŋ e wɛ̈t apɛi kekë yïlany e loi në wäl ëgël ë bairäth e luɔi de lɔtueŋ ë jïëcde në baŋde tɛ̈ɛ̈këic lëu bë tuany rac apɛi bëi ku wook rɔt.

sourceString: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
targetString: Kuën ë dac thëm akërnhiaam kök aye remdethibir thɔ̈ŋkɔu lɔn lëu ben naŋ wuɔ̈c ë jïn tënë jïc. Anɔŋ athëëm akïm kuötic tɔ̈ dhölic, nɔŋ yïk käŋ kerou cï ke loi në Panakïm ë Jama Cleveland; tök kë ye kënë kɔc nɔŋ tuany kor ku dɛ̈t kekë kɔc nɔŋ tuany rilic.

sourceString: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
targetString: Anɔŋ athëëmthëëm kediäk ë Bïtamin C e tuɔm ë guɔ̈pic loi rɔt ëmɛn tënë kɔc cï ke tääc ku a tuany apɛi në KOBIT-19. Ɣän kerou cï ke lëu në titë nyin piny (Caina, Kanada) ku töŋ cën titë nyin piny e (Itali).

sourceString: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
targetString: Wäläya de New York acë jɔk athëëm de antïbayotik adhithromycin kë Kol ye nïn 24, 2020

sourceString: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Tëde Pinynhom ë Pial Dït ëbai de Japan ku Wal(TPPW) ajuit athëëm ë kïm de Teijin Albethko(Cikalithonit) e kortiko Itheroid ye miɛt akɛ̈nythïn në wɛ̈t ë adhiäma kë ye yïlany de cït ë tuany tueŋ tënë ayanïïn cë wuɔk në koronabairäth.

sourceString: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
targetString: E kë ye tɔ̈ kë ye aŋiotenthin-ëye noŋ 2 wel, atëk athëëm ë II atɔ̈ dhölic kekë ayanïïn ke 200 bï ke gɔ̈t tënë ayanïïn ril këdɛnic apɛi tɔ̈ Denmak, Gërmani, ku Othtria ago ë piathë yïlac tïŋ të yïnen thïn.

sourceString: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
targetString: Kɔc yɔ̈ɔ̈p tɔ̈ thukulë piöu de Montriɛl tɔ̈ Kanada atɔ̈ ëmɛn ëke kuen lonë kolcicine në dhukë piny abiör ku riɛlë yic rälë piöu tënë cïtë tuany kor de KOBIT-19.

sourceString: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
targetString: Akuën cï cäk kë cɔl KOLKORONA , agɔ̈t kɔc dït nɔŋ ruön 40 lɔtueŋ ëke 6000 wɛ̈n cïnë ke KOBIT-19 yöök ke gup ku a yöök cïït thii kor ë ke gup wɛ̈n cë wïc tɛ̈ɛ̈c.

sourceString: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
targetString: Diär liɛc wälë thuëëtkï wälë acën dhöl piɛth ye lek röt tit në liɛ̈c ace ke gam.

sourceString: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
targetString: Antikoagulan kuötic aye ke them Itali

sourceString: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
targetString: Heparin nɔŋ athiɛk-ë molekula-tɔ̈ piny aye loi bïnë ayanïn alacu në kuɛr kuötic, en coth en Dutuc ke wɛl ke Itali bïk dhöl e kuany cök në luɔidɛnic piät bec.

sourceString: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
targetString: Ɣän kuötic në piööc në baŋ ayanïïn ke 300 yɔ̈ɔ̈pë luɔide enodhaparin thodiööm tënë propailadhïth ku kuɛr ke luɔi de lɔtueŋë pial e cï Itali caal kë Akɔ̈nydït ye nïn 14.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: Mënë ye SARS-CoV-2 bairäth, nyïn gäk apɛi e käkë wëi aacï wälë dhuŋe wɛlë bairäth nɔk cï ke gam në luɔndɛnic ɣɔn lui ke MERS, SARS ku wɛ̈th Nail bairäth cë dac lɔbec.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Ribabirin: ribabirin e cï than bïnë KOBIT-19 ya alacu në  të cït të cï kuënye cök në agɔ̈t de 7.

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Umipenobir: umipenobir e cï than bïnë yïlany de KOBIT-19 ya alacu në të cït të cï kuënyë cök agöt de 7

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Antibayotik kök cï kuën kë ke lëu bïk dhukë luɔndɛnic ëke yë ya yïlany dë KOBIT-19

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: Tocilidhumab (wälde - IL-6 e käŋ titic) cï Caina gam.

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: Thëëmthëëm tɔ̈ Itali ku Caina ëyɛ ku tïŋ Tocilithdhumab #KOBIT-19

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Wäl  ë tuöm de KOBIT-19 b'A e wäl ë haipothetikol yennë tuany de Koronabairäth 2019(KOBIT-19) tiɛt wei.

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: Acɔkë cën yen wäl e tuöm cï thääp thëëm në akïm, ka nɔŋ athëëm lɔtueŋ bïk ë wäl ë bëi bei.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: Në thökë Nyith 2020, kë e cï Akutnhom ë Pial Mɛ̈të Pinynhom(APMP)  lueel ke ce ŋɔ̈ɔ̈th bë wäl de SARS-CoV-2, ë ye yenne bairäthë jɔke, bë guɔ ya tɔ̈ ke pɛ̈i ke 18 kën bɛ̈n.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: Wɛl wɛ̈ɛ̈r kedhïc aake tɔ̈ atëk ë kuën ë pial I në Akɔ̈nydït ic .

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: KOBIT-19 ejɔl nyic në Ɣɔ̈r de 2019.

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Dhoŋ dïtë tuany e jɔl larär ë pinynhom në 2020 ic ago luɔide yɔ̈ɔ̈p cɔkë juak rɔt tëuë käŋ në lɔtueŋic.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Akutnhïïm juëc aloi käke jenom cï ke gät bec agokï wɛl ë tiëtë SARS-CoV-2 lëu në luɔi.

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: Në luɛlde në Akɔ̈nydït ic, ajɔkde CEPI në tëude në kɔc nhïïm tëde luɔi ë lɔtueŋ e walë awuur dït apɛi, adɛndɛn ë guërë bec, athëmde luɔide ku jɔla yöök de në pinynhom.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Në Akɔ̈nydït ic, MAT de kɔc e lui  ë käke wëi aayekï lueel lɔn ye ɣä wääc ke 10 ke  tëknɔlojï ake tɔ̈ në yɔ̈ɔ̈p cök ku lɔtueŋ në dhamɛn ajöökë 2020 ago cakë wäl lajik ë KOBIT-19 tit.

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: ɣänke mahëm cï ke tiëŋ kɔc nyin apɛi aacë ɣet tueŋ në atëk I de kuën piɛth nɔŋic:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: Nukëleik athit(DNA) ku RNA(Atëk I de atɛ̈ɛ̈t wäl wëër; Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: Bairal bɛkta(Atëkde I atɛ̈t ku wal tɔ̈ känë wɛ̈ɛ̈ric: KanThino Bayologik, nuɔu ë 5 de adenobairäth bɛkta)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: Cë mɛnë cïnë ye caal në diktoor ë CEPI në Akɔ̈nydït ic, adɛnë wɛl tɔ̈ në wɛ̈ɛ̈ric ke 115 aatɔ̈ në kanadɛn ajöökic de lɔtueŋë luɔi kekë 78 cï ke deet ke kek ajuɛr loi ëke kek lui thïn(79, në të cït të ye Thukulde Milkën ye luɛl thïn), ku 37 kök cï ke caal, lakin atɔ̈ ke thön kor tënë jäŋ juëc(e thɔ̈ŋic kë tɔ̈ ajuɛric wälë acak).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: Athëm ë I-II de Atëk e piath akërnhiaam loi ku athëm de immunojënithiti aye täu ë cï wɛr, muökë nyinthïn ë plecibo, ku ye tɔ̈ në ɣän kuötic, kë deet kä juëc lacar, dɛ̈k piɛth.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: Atëk athëmthëm ë III e naŋ kɔc juëc lui thïn, nɔŋ yïk akuut ë tïtë nyin, ku athëm ë luɔi piɛthë wal ago tuany gël ku yë böökë tïŋ në wɛ̈të mɛ̈ckëla lëu bï loi në dhamɛn dekë ye.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: Në wɛl tɔ̈ në wɛ̈ɛ̈ric ka 79 kek lui në lɔtueŋic (ëk cï ke deet në ajöök de Akɔ̈nydït 2020), 74 aake ŋot ëke kënë täu në athëm de kɔcic(aŋotë yɔ̈ɔ̈pë yöök ë de ic në akïm).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: Në të cït të e Kön nïn 24, 2020 pande Athurelia, jamade Kuinlan e cë caal lɔn kɔr kek piathde molekular wäl cök wɛ̈n lëu bë protin ke bairäth gerë luɔi ku bë käkë guɔ̈p gɛ̈lic në tuany cɔkë lui apiɛth.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Në të cït të e Kön nïn 24, 2020 pande Kanada, kë Tëde Wal Pinynhom ëbën(VIDO-TeWP) tɔ̈ jamade Thathkat cewan ecë caal yen jɔ̈kë lonë wal, ë ŋɔ̈th bë athëm de raan jɔɔk në 2021 ic.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Ajuɛr de lɔtueŋ ë wal e  cï Cainïth caal tëdɛnë gëlde tuany ku tïïtë nyinde kë nïnë Kön e 26, 2020, ku jɔla jamade Ɣöŋ Kɔŋ kë Kön e nïn 28.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Në të cït të e Kön nïn 29 de 2020, Kɔmpani ɣän wɛl de Janssen, muk Hanneke Schuitemaker, aacë caal lɔn cen luɔi jɔɔk në lɔŋde juɛ̈rë wal.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: Janssen e raan töŋë kɔc loi wäl dëk kekë raan de vaxart mët kek tëdɛnë biotechnology.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 18, 2020, kë BioSolutions e cë caal lɔn cen mat kekë vaxart tënë guër de wäl.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: Kë Nyith e nïn 8, 2020, go ɣönde këcïp de OncoGen tɔ̈ Romania e cë warɛk gät bec në të cït të bï wäl yiën thïn kë thöŋ kekë teknɔloji ɣɔn cï kaŋ loi kë ye neontigen de maguere ye tuɔm bë wɛ̈rë rot tëde tuany ya loi apiɛth.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 25 go madïrde thukul ë yɔ̈ɔ̈p caal lɔn cï kek  luɔi ë kä juëcic de wal thääpë luɔi ku aake jɔk athëmthëm.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Kë Nyith e nïn 27, 2020, go cirga e konyë dhukë  pinyde cinë ɣɔ̈c de generex NuGenerex Immuno-onkoloji caal lɔn loi kek ajuɛrde wal ago walë li-key peptite ku bë KOBIT-19 tiɛt wei.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Ake wïc bïk wal tɔ̈ në wɛ̈ɛ̈ric lëu bï them tënë kɔc bïk loi në "nïnic ke 90".

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 5 2020, go jaamade Washington tɔ̈ St. Louis e ca ajuɛrden ben wäl loi caal.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 5 2020, go Alathkëër de yɔ̈ɔ̈pë wal ka Amërika ku aduɔtka jeec tɔ̈ Fort Detrick ku thukul de Maryland e cɛɛlkï lɔn loi kek wäl.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Në të cït të ye Kol nïn 10 2020, e cɛɛl Biosolutions lɔn lui kek atök kenë Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: në luɔide ku guɛ̈rde wäl.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: Kek akutmɛ̈t aake cɛɛl ajuɛr de thëm akërnhiaam de athëmde kïm de atëk I de dïktoor në cït tënë Alɛthbor de 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 12, 2020, Wädhärade India de Pial e cë caal lɔn lui kek kenë wëëŋë thok ë 11 ku ë kënë ëyɛ atɔ̈ në kuënyë cökic alëu  bï löömë të cït tënë ruön-ku-nhuth agut cë të cït run kerou ku bïï wal jal loi.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 12 2020, cirga de Biotëknɔloji de Medicago tɔ̈ pande Quebec, ecë luɔi de kä la thueithuei cït-koronabairäth caal ëke ŋuɔtë ke kënë guɔ juir ëbɛ̈n tënë thukuulke Kanada de yɔ̈ɔ̈pë pial.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: Wal tɔ̈ në wɛ̈ɛ̈ric tëde thëm atɔ̈ ɣönde këcïp ë yɔ̈ɔ̈p, kekë athëm tënë kɔc e tɔ̈ në juɛ̈ric bë ya Alɛthbor wälë Aköldït de 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: Në ajɔ e läätë, go Guardian caal lɔn cï bënyë US cɔl Donald Trump e cë CureVac "gäm wëu juëc ago naŋ dhöl piɛth yökë walë Kobit-19" ku yennë kënë acï akumade German bɛ̈në maan.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Kë Kol e nïn 17 2020, cirga de Pfizer de ɣönë wɛl Amërika e cë caal lɔn cï kek mat kekë cirga de BioNTech ë Germany ku bïk wäl ë gëlë guöp ë mRNA loi atök.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: Wäl ë guöp gëlic ë BNT162, atɔ̈ ëmɛn kë them bï yök lɔn yök lɔn bï yen jal lui tënë raan ku athëmde piath lde tënë ayanïïn aye ŋɔ̈th kë jɔk në Alɛthbor de 2020 ic.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: Në Itali kë Kol e nïn 17, 2020, go cirgade Biotech ë kɔc ke Itali e cɔl Takis e cë caal ka bë naŋ nëtïja ë thëm ë wäl kënë guɔ gam ic në Akɔ̈nydït de 2020 ic ku wäldɛn ë guöp gëlic alëu bë thëm jɔɔk tënë raan në dhamɛn mäi ic.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: Tënë France kë Kol e nïn 19 2020, go kɔc cë ke cin mat në Ajuɛr ë baŋde Tuany (MAT) caal kë US$4.9 miliöön cï le täuë luɔi de wäl ë gëlë guöp në KOBIT-19 tënë akuut yɔ̈ɔ̈p nɔŋic thukul de Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria) ku jaama de Pittsburgh, e bëi ajuɛ̈rë cin de käke luɔi ë KOBIT-19 në të cït tënë miliöön US$29.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: MAT de Akutnhom ajuɛrdɛ̈t cë ke cin mat në baŋde KOBIT-19 ë luɔi ë wäl ë gëlë guöp aaye Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, jaama de Hong Kong, jaama de Oxford ku jɔla jaamde Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: Në Kol e nïn 20, 2020 ic, bäny ke pial ke Räcca e cïk caal lɔn cï kɔc ë lui ë käk kɔc guup cï kek jɔkë thëm ë läi de wɛlë gëlë guöp wääc.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: Kɔc ë yɔ̈ɔ̈p tɔ̈ jaama de Imperial tɔ̈ London e cïk caal kë Kol e nïn 20 2020 lɔn loi kek wäl ë gëlë guöp ë RNA e rɔt juak etök kë ye këde KOBIT-19.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: Wäl ë gëlë guöp tɔ̈ në wɛ̈ɛ̈ric ee loi në nïnic ka 14 ke dhamɛn ë löömë kä tɔ̈ në thäpic tënɔŋ Caina.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: Në thökde Kol, go akuma ë Kanada caal kë C$275 miliöön cï juar tënë ajuërë yɔ̈ɔ̈p ka 96 në baŋde gɔ̈ɔ̈rë wɛlë KOBIT-19 cök, nɔŋic yïk wɛl juëcë gëlë guöp tɔ̈ në thäpic tënɔŋ cirga de Kanada ku jaamɛt, cït yïk Medicago ku jaama de ajɔkde Saskatchewan.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Në ye dhamɛn töŋëic, go akuma ë Kanada caal kë C$192 miliöön ë kë cï ruök luɔi de wäl ë gëlë guöp në KOBIT-19 kekë ajuɛr bï kek "bɛŋë wäl ë gëlë guöp" dɛn bai loi kekë wɛl jöt ë guöp gëlic juëc wɛn lëu bï ke bɛ loi na be naŋ koronabairäth dɛ̈t be rɔt jatnhial.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: Kë Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 2, 2020, kɔc ë yɔ̈ɔ̈p tɔ̈ Jaama Pittsburgh de thukul ë wɛl e cë thëmde PittCoVacc caal, ëye wäl ë gëlë guöpë KOBIT-19 tënë riëc, ë luel kï lɔn "ye MNA ë SARS-CoV-2 S1 baakic ke wɛlke gëlë guöp cïke gam bec ëke cï juër antigen ril cï ruök käkë guöp gëlic [tënë riëc] ɣɔn cë röt nyuɔth në ajöök läät ka 2 ɛ̈ cï gɛmë wäl jɔɔk."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: Lɔŋde Kanada kë Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 16 2020, go jaama ë Waterloo de thukulë ɣönë wɛl caal lɔn cï kek gɔ̈cë wäl ë gëlë guöp tɔ̈ në wɛ̈ɛ̈ric ë DNA kë lëu bë ya kë ye kuɔɔth në umic.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Kë ye këde käm ke bairäth e rɔt nuɛt yen bï loi, kë DNA abï loi bë ciët käm tɔ̈ në guöpic ago kä lathueithuei cït-bairäth  ce nɛ̈k loi wɛ̈n lëu bë käke guöp titic jɔtnyïïn ago dhiëth në kä tit guöpic tënɔŋ SARS-CoV-2 bairäth

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: Në Kol ic 2020, go akuma de Amërika, cirga, ku jaama kediäk aake cë käŋ bɛ̈i bɛi bï keke kɔmpiöta dït rilë caathic tënë IBM, ë cï mat kekë käke kɔmpiöta tënë Hewlett Packard Enterprisen, Amazon, Microsoft ku jɔla Google

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: Wɛlë tiëtë guöp kök anɔŋ macakël kuötic, aaye ke cɔl kä cën macakël cï rok ëya.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: Yennë kënë aye nyuɔth ka nɔŋ riba yëkïk yök wär tuany gëlkï.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: Athëmdɛ̈t cï wɛr bec Athurelia awïc bë dïktoor ka 4,170 luöi.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: Alëu rot wal tɔ̈ në luɔiic acë bë piath wälë lui.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: Yɔ̈ɔ̈p cï dac loi në görë luɔi lajik ë wal kë yë loi në kä cï ruök KOBIT-19 në baŋde läi, cït yïk ACE2-riɛ̈c cïnë kë genom kɛn liäp kë genom ë kök, läi kök de ɣön këcïp, ku läi cën cëëkë kɔc, aye nyuɔth lɔn wïcë biosafety-kana de 3 ë mënyde bairäth pïr ku jɔla juir dït de pinynhom agorë dhilë nyic lɔn cïnë dhöl ë pial cɔ̈k.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: Wɛlke SARS ku MERS aacï ke them tënë läi cën ciɛ̈kë kɔc.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: Mɛ̈në 2020, acën walë yïlac wälë gël ë SARS cï nyuɔth kë lëu bï piath ku lui tënë kɔc.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: Në të cït të ye warɛk kë yɔ̈ɔ̈p ɣɔn cï gät bec dhamɛn 2005 ku 2006, nyuöthde ku luɔi de wɛl ë gël guöp ku wɛl ke yilac bïnë ke yïlɛnyë SARS e yene ketueeŋ ë tɔ̈ akuuma nhïm ku jɔla dutuuc ke pialë juɔr në pinynhom. Ayɛ acën wal ëtuöm ë guöp gëlicnë MERS cï yök.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: Mënë le MERS thiäi pinynhom, eye yök akutnhom ë yɔ̈ɔ̈p de SARS tɔ̈ ëmɛnë ka lëu bïk naŋ kë de luɔi lui apiɛth gam në baŋ de luɔi ë wɛlë tuömë gëlë guöp ku käkë guöp waric wuɔkë MERS-CoV.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: Mënë Kol 2020, e nɔŋ  töŋë (kënë DNA) walë gël MERS cë atëk ë thëëm ë I thääp thok tënë kɔc, ku kök ke diäk lɔtueŋ ëmɛn, keek ëbɛ̈n aaye wɛlke bairäth-cï rok, rou ëke adenobairäth- cï rok(ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac), ku töŋë MVA-cï rok(MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: Kä ye kɔc ke intërnɛt gät bec acë kë ye lueel wa bairäthë cɔk KOBIT-19 ca bɔ ka nyic ku walë gëlde atɔ̈.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: Ayanïn cï kɔc juëc ke intërnɛt luɛl bec në gɔ̈tdenic e ayanïn tɔ̈ ëke nɔŋ cäät ëtɔ̈ keke në guöpdenic e yë cök kuany ku wɛlë gël ëkä rilic ke koronabairäth kök cït yïk koronabairäth de SARS.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: b'koronabairäth de tuany ë 2019(KOBIT-19) e tuany e wuɔɔk në severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2(SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Cïtë dac tɔ̈ aanɔŋ yïk atuɔ̈c, ɣɔl, ku jɔla tɛ̈më wɛ̈i kɔ̈th.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: Cït kök alëu bïkic naŋ dɛ̈kë guöp, arɛmë rïŋic, yäc, tökë röl, cuök ŋör, ku arɛmë juny.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Në dhamɛnden ë döm agut cë lɔn bï cït röt jɔɔk e ya të cït tënë nïn kedhïc lakin alëu bë të cït tënë nïn kerou agut cë nïn thiärkuŋuan.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: Ë kä juëc e naŋ nëtïja de cït piɔlic, kë kök aaye lɔ bɛ̈në ke bairäth alir ë piöuic ku cuɔ̈k luɔi de käkë guöp juëëc kök.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: Mɛ̈në ye Akɔ̈nydït nïn 17, 2020, kä wär miliöön 2.24 aacï ke caal në bɛ̈ ka 210 ic ku ɣänthii lök, ku le naŋ nëtïja ke kë wär 153,000 cë thou.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Kä wär kɔc ka 568,000 aacë guup pial. Yennë tuanyë aye thiäi piny në kɛm ke kɔc në dhamɛn ë thiäkë yic, e ya thomthomthii dhiɛ e bɛ̈n në ɣɔlic, tïïmic, wälë jamic.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Kë thomthomthii kä e bɛ̈n bei në wëëiic, aaye lɔ̈ny piny wälë këdɛ̈ kɔ̈u kë cë lɔn yennë ye wuɔɔk kë mec.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Kɔc ëyɛ alëu bïk wuɔk të gɔt kek këdɛ̈ kɔ̈u ku jɔlkï ke nyïïn, um, wälë thok gɔ̈t.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: Yen bairäth alëu bï pïr në këdɛ̈ kɔ̈u në të cït tënë thää ke 72.
